column2: 25-34 on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$5$Been rx'd adhd meds since the 3rd grade. 20mg x 2 when I wake up. This has been the best by far for the longest too. Still have to be diligent in eating big breakfast bc no Appetite during day n blood sugar can drop but dnt have the crash after its worn off which many others can. Feels like it stays working steadily as it should from about 630am to 330-4pm. Does make ya have to #2 some mrngs when it first starts to kick in but nothing crazy. Important to take as prescribed or your sleep and eating will go downhill quick

column1: 3$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$1/19/2019 1:02:53 PM$Reviewer: Cambria7
column2: 25-34 on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $5$5$5$I was first prescribed 20mg Adderall Instant Release 3x daily and had bad headaches

column2: 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $4$5$5$Actually
column3: my reason for taking this medication is that I have ADD. I'm not Hyperactive
column4: but that was the only choice I was given. I am so glad that I was diagnosed and I was able to start this medication The only reason that I didn't give it 5 stars for effectiveness is because I think that I should be on the next higher dose! Taking this medication has turned my life around. Before my ADD caused so many problems in my home life that my wife and I almost split up. I had a lot of problems finishing things that I started or remembering to do something because my mind would wander. Now I am able to stay on task and finish what I start. I only wish that I would have been diagnosed with this problem about 40 years ago. I wonder how it would have changed my working career?

column1: 26$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$10/20/2014 12:27:56 PM$Reviewer: Kelton
column2: 19-24 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $4$3$5$I have been taking Adderall XR for roughly 7 years now in varying doses from 30mg to 10mg to 20mg now. My Father is a phycologist specializing in children with learning disabilities so as a child i tried several different drug (names of which i do not remember) that failed to work for me or caused too many side effects. i had been taking a 30mg dose daily for about 5 years before i decided i wanted to wain off of it so no im on a lower dose. Although i have read that there are a rather large number of side effects i have only experienced a lack in hunger and occasion difficulty to sleep (only on days when ive been late taking it). overall this drug has helped me significantly in school and general day to day life although i am concerned about the lack of knowledge in the long term use of this drug.

column1: 36$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$3/24/2014 12:50:17 PM$Reviewer: bohunk
column2: 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $5$5$5$"I saw this and figured I would throw my two-cents in. There are naysayers who will question my post but
column3: I am 55 yrs old and take two Adderall 25mg caps daily. No significant increase in BP ( it went up a bit only by 3 pts ) and no heart issues except I am a couch potato ! This is a "" wonder drug "" for me since being diagnosed by 2 psychologists and a doctor on 2002. The main reason for all the professional people was my doctor making sure I was not faking Adult ADHD just to get "" speed "" for no good reason. My doctor told me there is almost a steady stream of junkies trying to hustle him for dope ( meds that are not needed ). I had to work close with my doctor to get the right dose. Look at it like a lone window on one side a garage. You want to get "" inside "" the window
column4: not before it or after it. ADHD meds no good if either or. That may explain why many parents "" freak out "" when their kid gets actually worse. Adderall may not be right for all persons. With my 49 yr old brother
column5: Ritalin works best. Hope this helps."

AS far as ADHD symptom
column2: it pretty much eliminated them. However
column3: Adderall has some side effects. I experienced rapid heart rate
column4: higher blood pressure
column5: extreme ""states of concentration"" (to the point where I could sit and do 500 math problems without stopping

column7: weight loss

column12: for me

column14: however

column2: 7-12 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Caregiver) $5$5$5$My 9yr old son has been on Adderall for almost 4 years now.  He has ADHD and Ausperger's. WITH IT he can focus in school
column3: his behavior is more age-appropriate
column4: he is more successful in completing tasks
column5: and in general is much more in control of his own actions.  WITHOUT IT the change is remarkable - he is hyper
column6: impulsive
column7: and spirals out of control. He knows how he wants to be
column8: but gets frustrated as he is unable to help himself. I would reccommend this medication to anyone who's child  has ADHD
column9: as I see no reason for the patient to struggle with the disorder and feelings of failure
column10: shame
column11: low self-esteem
column12: etc. that go with it.  It's an appropriate treatment for ligitimate medical condition!  We monitor his dose very carefully
column13: and don't give it after 10:30AM
column14: so he has no trouble sleeping at night. Others have mentioned addiction issues. That won't happen unless one abuses their meds and starts down that slope.  I suggest that if it weren't Adderall they abused
column15: it would be another substance
column16: so please DON'T BLAME THE MEDICINE - blame the addictive behavior.(and I mean no disrespect
column17: I truly empathize with those people and what they endured)

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $5$5$4$"I recently was diagnosed (again) with adhd. My parents didn't believe in this disorder nor treating it when I was young. Within the past year my wonderful physician and I have been trying many different adhd medications and finally found that Adderall XR works for me. It is an amazing medication making it possible for me to function normally finishing tasks which is huge for me because I have 3 small children with many many school and extracurricular activities. I no longer feel like I'm losing my mind thinking I was going crazy forgetting things starting many tasks at once and never finishing them not sleeping due to my mind never ""turning off""! 97$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$12/6/2011 5:55:31 PM$Reviewer: theADHDmomME, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $4$3$5$When I first started taking Adderall XR (10mg) it was like I got my life back. I was just recently diagnosed with severe ADHD, moderate depression, and mild anxiety. I have known that something wasn't right with me since I was very little but I have parents who were in denial and too afraid of stigmas and what other ppl think about them to have had any help until now. With Adderall so far I have noticed that altho it definitely helps my concentration/focus/motivation it causes me to hyperfocus (act OCD) about certain things, my anxiety is worse, and I get mean and brutally/cruelly honest with those around me at times. I've also noticed that I talk to myself more often (which I've always done to a certain extent; like when I'm frustrated, doing math, or figuring something out)but now is more noticeable. I also have very bad dry mouth, an unquenchable thirst, and chapped lips. I can't go anywhere without a bottle of water and chapstick now. Otherwise, the sleep problems and loss of appetite went away after the first 3 days. Right now I'm in the 'deciding' phase trying to figure out if the benefits outweigh the side effects. I know that I have to continue some sort of medication along with my cognitive behavioural therapy because I can't function at normal expectations at this point otherwise but I'm uncomfortable with some of the possible side effects and the idea of becoming dependant. I have a history of street drug use(I self-medicated as a teen/young adult) and altho I have been clean for years I am always very careful and afraid of becoming that person again. Up until recently, I had only heard positive things about Adderall but now I'm not so sure. I guess I will finish off this month, talk to my psych more about it, and then go from there...

column1: 118$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$8/27/2011 10:01:49 PM$Reviewer: way too fly guy
column2: 13-18 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$5$I have tried a few different ADHD and this has worked the best for me by far. My ADHD is mostly impulsivity
column3: but hyperactivity was also sometime problematic. Concentration was never really a problem for me. In school I often got in trouble for shouting out answers without being called on. Also before I started Adderall I almost always reacted before I thought
column4: and said and did a lot things that I regretted later. Now I usually think out actions before I act
column5: so I get in a less fights now. The only drawbacks to the medication are because it is extended release you HAVE to remember to take it early in the day or else you will be up like all night. Also  probably the only real side effect that bothers me is the apetite reduction. But I have found the best way to get around that is eat a good breakfast before you take it
column6: and have some healthy snacks around the house for when the medicine wears off night so you can have something to eat. Overall I am very satisfied with Adderall xr and a pleasant surprise was if I woke up too late and didn't take it  I didn't experience any major negative consequences
column7: but I did have to try a little bit harder to make sure I was thinking before I spoke.

column1: 122$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$7/6/2011 1:08:24 PM$Reviewer: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $5$5$5$"I have been on Adderall XR since it first came out.  I have been taking meds for ADHD for 28 yrs now.  I like Adderall XR because it lasted longer than the Ritalin
column2: therefore I didn't have the up down up down feeling.  Adderall is a smoother transition too.  Of course it is not a cure all.  I still watch what I eat
column3: work on time management
column4: and do the occasional talk therapy.  I have also been the subject of multiple studies on ADHD since I was ""raised on Ritalin"" here it what I learned.  I am more prone to Alcoholism
column5: I am more prone to ""falling in love""
column6: I am more prone to acting out my anger.  Actions and feelings are easy impulses but my ADHD is not an excuse.  My mind understands
column7: what has been so hard is to delay the impulse whether I am on medication or on a medication vacation.  I take 30mg of Adderall XR in the morning
column8: 30 mg of ritalin in the afternoon
column9: 80 mg of Straterra
column10: and 300mg of Wellbutrin.  All this Medication in one day so I take med vacations in order to lower my tolerance.  Funny thing is I am only diagnosed with ADHD.  Believe me Doctors have tried to find some other condition bc ADHD usually is combined with ""something else"" but I am a classic ADHD case.  Getting meds for ADHD is easy now adays what is hard is taking responsibility for your treatment after your diagnosis.  I quit drinking
column11: have taken the anger and time management classes
column12: and married a man I respected.  I also don't use my ADHD as an excuse in my professional life
column13: my employeers don't need to know my personal life.  Finally Yoga has had a great affect on my ability to focus
column14: HUGE.  I hope the people who are ADHD make it clear to their Doctors that the H means hyperactive NOT manic.  I have experienced too many non ADHD doctors who are ready to label and prescribe the newest ""condition"".  I don't have much respect for the medical communities understanding of ADHD.  All I know is that the medication is only one part of the equation
column15: its the easy part.  Good luck i hope i helped."

column1: 126$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$6/29/2011 11:28:10 AM$Reviewer: trailrider
column2: 45-54 Male  (Patient) $4$4$5$I've probably lived my entire 49 yrs with undiagnosed ADD
column3: but over years of building defense mechanisms to compensate
column4: it evolves into issues that don't fit the traditionally accepted symptoms. I was never hyperactive
column5: don't currently have difficulty reading or focusing on specific tasks. I do however
column6: tend to hyperfocus
column7: don't like interruption and don't transition very easily. I also don't like a lot of activity and noise as that affects my ability to focus. At times
column8: my mind is being barraged with a bunch of external and internal stimuli. It becomes too much and I will get irritable and react negatively to my family. It's not the way I feel inside
column9: but it's all right on the surface trying to defend my focus. It has evolved into a degree of anxiety and depression about the inability to soften the impact of stimuli. I was starting to get more and more down
column10: more withdrawn
column11: and dark. I tried some of the anxiety/depression medication like Zoloft (a year and a half)
column12: but I felt more anxiety from them. I am not sure the Zoloft ever worked for me at all. I finally decided one day to try my daughter's Adderal (she also has ADD). The difference was significant. 80% of the negative stimuli dissipated and was replaced with positive feelings... confidence
column13: patience
column14: peace. Everything became more manageable and I felt a lot more normal. So after a couple months on Adderal XR25
column15: it is working pretty well... not perfect
column16: but a lot better. I also tried Focalin and was initially prescribed Vyvanse. The Vyvanse laid too heavy on me and I felt out-of-body. The Focalin was better
column17: but the Adderal XR25 seemed the best fit. For adults
column18: symptoms and issues around ADHD don't fit the traditional. The psych said adult ADHD is in the process of being redefined by the medical community.

column1: 139$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$3/15/2011 4:57:31 PM$Reviewer: Cubclubber17, 19-24 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $4$2$3$Very good medication for keeping focused for patients with ADD or ADHD. I had adult ADHD so my mind would try to focus on multiple things at once and it would overload. For the first few months the medication was great.
The last year and half has gone from good times to a living hell. I upped my dose from 20 mg to 20 mg and 15 mg in the afternoon. That is when the living hell began.

It made me feel like the world around me didn't matter. The only two things I cared about were my grades and my girlfriend. Everything else was non existent in my mind. I started losing friends left and right
column2: I became a lot less sociable
column3: and my parents knew something was up. When my only other friends I had told me what they noticed
column4: the medication made me not believe them and I then became very paranoid.

column1: I thought everyone around me was an enemy looking to make my life miserable someway or another. My anxiety levels skyrocketed and I always had my head on a swivel. It was a terrible way to live life. I even started thinking my girlfriend was up to no good when she wasn't around me so I started becoming clingy to her.

Thank God I stopped taking this medication. I found self worth in myself again and I my ex friends became friends with me again. Everyone in my life noticed a great difference and that's when I realized I needed to stop taking this medication.
My advice
column2: ""DON'T TAKE THIS MEDICATION UNLESS YOUR ADD/ADHD IS RUINING YOUR LIFE."" And if you have to use this medication
column3: make sure you use it only on the days you need to concentrate. Your life can spin out of control if you take this medication for an extended amount of time in my experience."

column3: which wasn't hard at all for me. I was off medication completely for 3 years and went back on Ritalin this time. I now only take 15mg of Ritalin as opposed to 25mg of Adderall and I can focus enough to do my work and still go to sleep at night. For those of you who have ADD I (not hybrid or hyperactive) and are experiencing side effects I definitely recommend trying other forms of stimulants. It might take some time to find the right match (like finding the right girlfriend or wife) but it is so worth the effort.

column1: The effect is steady throughout the day rather that having the ups and downs of regular Adderall. column1: 225$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$3/12/2010 1:15:34 PM$Reviewer: yael
column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $4$1$5$"I have been taking Adderall XR
column3: 50mg/day (30 in the morning
column4: 20 in the afternoon) for about four years.  Before that
column5: I took Dexedrine.  With the exception of ages 18-21
column6: I took some form of stimulant since age 13.

column1: Adderall is highly addictive.  I feel it has ruined my life.  I loved the euphoric feeling and weight loss side effects
column2: but it was so addictive I broke down and took it during my last trimester of pregnancy and now I fret it has caused a disproportionately small head size in my11-week-old daughter.  (weight and length are off the charts but head is only 50th percentile
column3: and was only 25th percentile at birth)

column1: It was also so addictive I quit breastfeeding at 5 weeks to go back on the meds.
Now it's causing dry mouth to the point of receding gums and ruining my teeth
column2: and I'm still considering going back on it.  (when I realized the affect it was having on my dental health -- I quit taking it
column3: and that was 2 days ago.  The fatigue from the withdrawal is crushing.)

column1: I wish my parents had never started me on these meds.
Please
column2: parents
column3: do not start your kids on these meds.  Their ADD can be an asset -- there are different perceptions of this 'disorder'.  They are better at multitasking and can hyperfocus when they are truly passionate about something...

column1: The drugs are a gateway to a nightmare.
There is no magic bullet."
226$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$3/11/2010 8:49:30 PM$Reviewer: $3$4$4$
227$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$3/10/2010 10:24:42 AM$Reviewer: spofford
column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $1$1$5$"Some practical advice: 1) be rigorously honest with yourself as to whether you have a TRUE
column3: objective diagnosis of ADHD! 2) heed the warnings about using this drug is you have ANY issue with addictive behavior.

column1: I probably do have ADHD but I am convinced that my use of Add over 2 years contributed to my life spinning out of control. I became impulsive
column2: sometimes agressive
column3: etc; started drinking excessively to ""come down""
column4: mind was moving too fast to deal with life issues. Be wary of statement on this website that benefits should outweigh side effects! For me
column5: it was great for a while but wow
column6: did it help me mask life and land in a ditch (literally as during one episode I totalled my vehicle). Remember that the generic name is ""amphetamine"" and this is
column7: for me
column8: just a nicely packaged pharmaceutical called ""speed"". I'm now dealing with life on life's terms; not perfect
column9: but drug free and I pray I never go back!  Again
column10: rigorous honesty!"

column1: 228$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$3/9/2010 7:08:58 PM$Reviewer: Tamara

column3: but noticed some hysteria in getting a blood test done (after 3 attempts
column4: we still haven't succeeded).  When she comes ""down"" from the meds
column5: she really cycles out of control.  We just had our last and final episode of the med...she totaly ""wigged out""....worse than the previous hysteria...all about cleaning her room.  It took my husband and me 45 min to calm her down.  She was mentally and physically exhausted.  We were terrified by what we witnessed.  She's only been off the med since Sat.
column6: but so far she's feeling better.  I'm scard to try something else
column7: afraid of what those side effects might be.  We also read about Adderall being taken off the Canadian market because of severe side effects
column8: including death.  Unfortunately
column9: this didn't warrant its removal from the US market and I only learned about this AFTER the troubles my daughter went through."

column1: 230$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$3/2/2010 8:44:15 PM$Reviewer: Melanie
column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$1$5$"I wish I could give this drug 0 stars for satisfaction.  I have been taking Adderall XR for over 3 years.  I am now considering changing to a different ADHD med.  Here's why:

column1: When I filled my prescription for DAW (dispense as written) name brand Adderall XR
column2: the pharmacist showed me that all the pills in the name brand bottle were all imprinted with M. Amphet. Salts - just like the generic. She even opened a new bottle
column3: to show me that Walgreens wasn't trying to screw me over.

column1: I called Shire and they said that the FDA approved Shire imprinting the name brand capsules with either ADERALL XR or M. Amphet. Salts and that as long as my prescription came from a name brand bottle that said ""Shire"" that I was taking the same name brand drug I've been taking all along.
I HIGHLY doubt what I've been taking for the past few days is regular name brand Aderall XR. I have been experiencing headaches
column2: as well as
column3: tight/clenched upper back muscles
column4: tingling/numbness in my face and pressure behind my eyes. I also feel like I'm on something - I never felt like I was on something when I took name brand Adderall XR before!

column1: I called Shire again and again they told me that as long as my prescription came from a bottle that said ""Shire"" that I was taking the same name brand drug.  Shire is lying."

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$4$Finding Adderall XR has been like divine intervention for me. I have severe ADHD that runs in my family. My brother has ADD and my sister has hyperactivity without the inattentiveness that she finds highly adaptive. My nephew (brother's son) took Adderall with great results for many years. Although I have had a lifelong history of ADHD (and was in special ed) I had always been misdiagnosed. I won't even go into the crazy things I was labelled with. Despite such a grim prognosis I was able to complete grad school with a 4.0 average at USC and obtain a professional license in health care. When I tried to obtain meds for ADHD this was used against me and I was told that I could not be this successful with severe ADHD and was even labelled bi-polar by the chief of neurology due to my hyperactivity which has become worse when I turned 50. Finally a colleague prescribed Strattera which not only made my sick it also gave me nightmares. Next was Concerta which worked great but gave me such severe dry mouth that it destroyed my mucous membranes. Recently I switched to Adderal. By this time I was saying my prayers. It works great! I had mild dry mouth that was self-limiting and am on top of my game. The best thing is the improve social skills due to < impulsivity and the improved concentration. I am a new woman! Thank you shire. I take 20 mg QAM and 10 mg in the afternoon. It also decreases my PTSD symptoms. From reading the posts my experience appears unusual and I hope it encourages adults.

column1: 242$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$2/5/2010 2:34:10 PM$Reviewer: john doe
column2: Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$5$I've tried Vyvanse
column3: Strattera and concerta for my ADHD.  Adderall XR is the best hands down.  Strattera didn't work at all and the concerta was ok but didn't last 12 hours like it's supposed to
column4: plus my liver enzymes tested high on it.  Vyvanse gave the worse sides.  My eyes were always bloodshot and I was always paranoid.  I feel at ease and can focus and concentrate for long periods of time at school and work.  For people that legitmitally have ADD/ADHD like me
column5: this drug works wonders
column6: provided that you take it properly and DO NOT crush the beads and snort it or inject it.  It is meant to be taken orally and create and acheive a steady baseline level so there aren't as many highs and lows throughout the day.  One side effect I have found out to be negative is that it takes me 2 hours to fall asleep at night.  Aside from that
column7: I now live a normal life and excel in both school and work.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $5$5$4$"I am 25 and have been on Adderall XR since I was 14. Adderall has worked very well for me. Some of the benefits for me are increased focus
column3: ability to effectively process information and form and express coherent thoughts more effectively. When I am on my medicine
column4: I find it easier to complete tasks
column5: whereas without the medication
column6: completing even the easiest of tasks (like unpacking groceries) is difficult because I get sidetracked. When I am not on my medicine I tend to exhibit a lot of impulsive behaviors
column7: but on my medicine
column8: I am better able to think before I act
column9: so to speak. Another benefit is that I am not bored as frequently. One obvious negative side effect is loss of appetite. I lost a lot of weight in the first year or so of being on Adderall. I could easily go for a day without eating. I just didn't look healthy. Some of my family members and teachers thought I had become anorexic and were getting worried. After I graduated college
column10: I went off Adderall for about a year and hated it. I gained back the weight I had lost plus more because of nervous/bored eating
column11: and I struggled in school (in my masters program)
column12: at work
column13: and some of my relationships with others suffered. I have been back on Adderall XR for about 3 months now and am much happier with life in general. I just feel more balanced and in control of myself
column14: which is nice. I have noticed decreased appetite
column15: but to a MUCH lesser extent than in high school and college. Some of the negative side effects I have always experienced while on the drug are decreased sex drive (although that has improved)
column16: dry mouth
column17: and what I call ""hyper-focus"" - the inability to switch from one task to another. The effectiveness of AdderallXR obviously varies from person to person
column18: as do the positive and negative side effects. THough I have had some negative side effects
column19: my overall experience with AdderallXR has been VERY positive."

column1: 258$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$1/10/2010 8:40:22 PM$Reviewer: butters
column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $5$5$5$Don't use it for concentation.  Take a nap or a walk.  There are actually real medical reasons to use it.  If your not eating then make a note to remind your self to eat
column3: if you have dry mouth drink more fluids.  If you can't sleep try a snack before bed or a warm bath or maybe you're dose is too high.  You shouldn't go OCD from it. I've been misdiagnosed for over 3 years and this is year 4 and I've started a new dr and the generic form of Adderall XR and since I've never taken anything else I can't compare it with the label or any other type stimulant.  I've started on 10mg and will be on 20mg next week.  I can sleep
column4: eat and have been slowly teaching myself to slow down and pay attention to what I'm doing and to listen better.  It also has been on the market for years and the side effects are small compared to some you may not even know exist until later. :)

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $5$5$5$"This medication works great for me.  I have no side effects. I sleep better than before
column3: have a regular appetite
column4: no dry mouth
column5: no mood swings. I take only 10 or 15 mg per day. I'm sure I could take more for better concentration and to stay on task easier
column6: but I take the minimal amount of medication I need to enable me to use the other coping skills I have developed. This drug should be used to help ADD symptoms
column7: it's not a cure. We need to learn skills to deal with our ""handicap"". Taking medication can take away enough of the noise and chaos to allow us to learn coping skills. For some who have described negative symptoms
column8: try cutting back a little at a time
column9: it may be a little harder to concentrate but it may eliminate the negative effects and still give some positive relief for ADD.     "

column6: but the positive effects outweighed the negative effects by far.  Once I had been taking it for a while
column7: I was able to eat normally again
column8: but people who are under-weight should be monitored in order to make sure they are eating enough.  Another thing about this medication is that it is very addictive.  It has been effective for me for the past 4 years
column9: but I am unable to function normally without it.  People who are prescribed Adderall XR should be aware that they may become dependent
column10: and if they are to discontinue taking it
column11: they should definitely taper their dosage down fairly slowly.  Overall
column12: Adderall XR has been an incredible improvement for my concentration.  I believe
column13: however
column14: that it should not be administered to young children because of it's strong effects.  If it is needed for a child
column15: they should take the lowest effective dose.

column1: 352$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$7/8/2009 1:00:45 PM$Reviewer: MoKs13
column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $4$4$5$"I was diagnosed with ADHD in 3rd grade when I started taking ritalin. The medication gave me ""ticks"" and terribled anxiety. I was off med treatment for adhd by the time i was 14. I managed to get through highschool and 2 years of college despite the trouble and chaos i got myself into. about a year ago i started taking adderall for my ADHD again. the first 8 months were great. my racing thoughts became more organized and i was able to prioritize my tasks in order to complete them. If you look at other posts listed here the users of 1-6 mo will have more positive feedback than those of long term. its been about a year and im trying to get myself off of this. i have started to experience withdrawal symptoms in the morning and evening. theyre terrible. i could avoid these symptoms by upping my dose but ultimatly that would be masking rather than solving. which is what so many people do. the drug is seriously effective for adhd but i would warn on dose amounts to be sure your not masking harmful dependency signs or the outcome in the longrun will be way worse than any adhd symptoms you thought were bad."

column1: 353$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$7/7/2009 3:25:33 PM$Reviewer: Momof3
column2: 7-12 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Caregiver) $5$5$5$"My son is now 11 and has been taking Adderal XR for about 3 years now. In the begining we tried a different medcation that was not lasting long enough for him. So we tried Adderal and over night we saw a big differance in him. He was about to concentrate through the whole day. I noticed that he would get emotional in the afternoon.  The way we fixed this was to make sure he had a snack in the afternoon to re-boost the medication.  The medication is time released right? so the reason for mood swings in the afternoon is because lack of protein in the body.  Try this and you should see a differance.

362$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$6/10/2009 9:46:42 PM$Reviewer: KristaG, 13-18 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $5$1$1$The medication did its job, but the side effects were to strong for me. I had bad mood swings. I was dizzy all of the time. I was so tired, but I could not sleep. Eating made me feel like I was going to throw up. I was keeping my room clean and doing everything I was supposed to do because of the medication. I was more focused and serious about things, but I lost friends. I was no longer myself anymore. It took everything people loved about me away. I recomend to think before you use this drug and to be careful if you have important things coming up. The side effects totally changed who I was and what I could do. The friends I told about this were the ones that helped me when they started to notice things and that helped. When I finally stopped it took awhile for me to fully lose the side effects. Keep up with your side effects and make sure you think is it better for me to stop or keep going. In my case the bad totally wiped out the good. 
363$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$6/10/2009 4:39:02 PM$Reviewer: Michelle45, 13-18 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $4$1$5$I have gotten most of the side effects on and off. The drug did help with my being able to focus but with the side effects I have gotten, I will most likely have to stop taking the drug.

366$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$6/3/2009 11:04:55 PM$Reviewer: figrditout, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $5$5$5$I have been taking Adderall since last November (08). I was started on 20mg of Adderall xr
column2: then went to 25 mg xr
column3: and now I take 25mg xr in the morning around 6am
column4: and then an Adderall IR
column5: 10mg
column6: around noon to one p.m. I think Adderall works great
column7: the problem I had was that even though it is an XR formulation it seemed to wear off around noonish everyday. I was never able to get ""all day coverage"". In February my doctor added the 10mg IR ""booster"" and it has worked great ever since. He told me that every one's body metabolism is different and some get longer coverage than others. This is what worked for me. I was worried about sleep issues being on this dose
column8: the amazing thing is I actually feel like I sleep better since being on this medication. When I lay down to go to sleep I don't have a million and one things floating through my head like I use to. It's like the background ""white noise"" is gone. My thoughts are so much clearer now and I can actually get things accomplished instead of 20 things half accomplished. It's too bad people abuse this drug
column9: it's makes it more difficult for people who use it for legitimate medical purposes to get it. All of my other medications I can get a 90 day supply in the mail. With Adderall I have to go to my doctors office every month and pick up my prescription in person. Other than that absolutely no complaints. Good luck to all."

column3: however
column4: I am very consiencious due to the fact that I am a recovering alcoholic for 14 years. Adderall xr has changed my life. 405$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$3/19/2009 3:06:02 PM$Reviewer: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $4$4$5$I have been taking 25mg of Adderall XR for almost 3 months now. I have to say I've had a pleasent experience with this. I am in Nursing school, so the Adderall gives me that extra push I need. I feel like I constantly need to be studying, I listen & take better notes in class, and my grades have got better. I am also able to study for longer periods of time because I have more energy & can stay up later. However, I have had some pretty drastic side effects. I occasionally have dry mouth, but my anxiety & stress seems to be 10000 times worse, I seem to make situations alot worse than they actually are. I am ALOT more irratible & don't have much patience. It has made me very blunt, so I hope noone makes me mad. & my finger has got to where it twitches but other than that.... & on the days I don't take it, i'm so tired, I can hardly keep my eyes open but i'm in a happier mood, just too tired to do anything. So for the most part, my exp. with Adderall has been good. ALOTTT better than Methyphenidate (wayyyy ti many SE!) which I was taking prior to the Adderall XR.

418$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$3/2/2009 12:17:42 PM$Reviewer: Pete, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $4$4$5$I'm 47 years old and was diagnosed late with ADD.  School was a nightmare, barely got though college.  No ability to work towards a goal, concentrate, or stay organized.  Originally diagnosed an treated for dep./anx. in my thirties, but it was my ADD that caused these issues.  Started taking 20mgs. of Adderrall.  I'm enjoying life now as never before because because it helps me focus, organize, and want to interact more with people.  My only worry is that I hear Canada has banned it because of risk of stroke, heart problems, and hardening of the arteries.  I'm going to ask mo doc about it.  Another worry, my five year old (I have four kids under seven) seems to be just like his old man.  I would be devastated to have to put him on this during his physical development.  We'll see how kindergarten goes.  For adults with true ADD, it could drastically change your life for the better!  Did mine.

column1: 455$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$1/11/2009 4:31:47 PM$Reviewer: livinggood
column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$5$"I have been on Adderall xr 25mg for about 3 months now.  I'm 6'2"" tall and weigh 200lbs.  I can easily sum up Adderall xr by saying WOW!!  I used to be very very anti anything ADD/ADHD
column3: I use to think it was a way for the pharmaceutical companies to ""push more drugs"" on us.  What changed my thinking was when my son was having a lot of trouble with school work and was diagnosed with ADHD.  I saw the exact same symptoms in him that I had when I was young.  I have always had trouble in school.  It wasn't that I wasn't interested I just couldn't stay focused long enough to get into the material.  I went and spoke with my family doctor
column4: told him the situation
column5: the symptoms I was having
column6: my past school performance
column7: current job performance
column8: etc... and he decided to prescribe me Adderall xr 25mg.  Another thing he told me to do was to cut out ALL caffeine
column9: which I did.  The first three days I popped Ibuprofen all the time because of caffeine withdrawal headaches but after that the transformation has been wonderful.  I have had anxiety problems with mild depression for as long as I can remember
column10: actually anxiety runs on my side of the family.  Starting the first day with Adderall I could tell a big difference.  I had that euphoria that everyone writes about but my thinking
column11: concentration
column12: my ability to prioritize
column13: and get things done has been AMAZING.  Now that I have been on the med for a little over 3 months the euphoria feeling is gone
column14: that was gone in the first few days of use
column15: but my ability to stay focused
column16: concentrate
column17: prioritize
column18: and basically ""get er done"" has been excellent
column19: actually after a month of being on the med it seemed like it improved somewhat again
column20: I actually find myself speaking slower and more methodically.  I couldn't be happier.  I actually think that A LOT of my anxiety and mild depression have been related to my NOT being diagnosed with ADD sooner in my life.  Since starting this med I actually feel like a different person. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED."

Most of my friends said they knew i already had it but it was not that apparent to me. The diagnosing doctor told me my life would improve drastically to the medication and what it has to offer. Well
column4: within months of starting the medication my employer created a new position for me as i was finally able to focus. My finances are getting back on track (paying stuff off instead of frivolous spending). Relationship i am working on but i am finally more focused on taking my career even further. I wish i would have taken this approach earlier in my life. I am now 33 and finally living my life the way i want. I used to sleep terrible
column5: now i actually have no issues falling asleep (most of the time anyway). My dreams arent random and dont wake me up anymore and i dont feel that everyday should not end cause i didnt get everything done. If you feel the same and are wondering why you are like you are go to a behavioral therapist. You life WILL improve just as my therapist told me it would. Now to find Mrs. Right ;)

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $5$3$5$"OKAY

column6: I noticed that my anxiety has gotten worse. I will get paranoid about stupid things that aren't worth getting paranoid about.  Does anyone know why this is? Plus

column1: 465$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$12/26/2008 11:14:23 PM$Reviewer: funkyjam
column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $4$1$5$"I am  a 38 year old male. My ADHD diagnosis at the age of 35 was liberating. I saw the 'top' doctor in NYC who charged $750 and saw me for 15 minutes to make the diagnosis - promptly prescribing Adderall RX. Each subsequent $250 session lasted less than 5 minutes to monitor my progress on the Adderall RX. Initially things were great. I was able to focus on tasks
column3: I did not get drowsy driving and my appetite was manageable. I actually lost 12 pounds! I saw that as a positive side-effect. At the time I started
column4: I read that Adderall RX was the new Hollywood diet drug
column5: so I felt tres chic! Anyway
column6: it took me a while to realize that Adderall RX was making me less tolerant with more feelings of rage. At one point
column7: I broke a full length mirror in my wife's office by impulsively putting my shoe through it during a heated argument. I MUST NOTE THAT I HAVE NEVER DONE ANYTHING LIKE THIS BEFORE IN MY LIFE!!! I also felt what I could only describe as a pain in my liver after several months of taking the drug. If I stopped temporarily
column8: the pain went away. As soon as I resumed
column9: the pain came back. Another leading NYC expert consulted with a top expert at Mt. Sinai
column10: who had never heard of this side effect. Whether it was recorded or not
column11: I had it and don't since stopping the med. My course on Adderall RX lasted about 9 months. I also was in a n ADHD group therapy class. In the end
column12: I deceided that this is who I am
column13: that drugs are not a miracle cure and that the pain in my liver and feeling enraged was not something that was worth the extra focus and appetite suppression. I do keep a stash for long driving trips
column14: because it absolutely keeps me alert and I don't feel like I have to pull off the road to nap. Hope this helps. WOuld love to know if others felt this pain in their right side or
column15: as I describe
column16: my liver."

column1: 470$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$12/18/2008 4:53:41 PM$Reviewer: William
column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $3$1$5$"I have been taking Adderall XR for nearly 5 years. I am now 41. I started on 20mg and noticed an immediate differance in my focus and energy. But soon the effectivness wore off and I went up to 40mg... then 60... then 80... then 100... then 120mg. I began to experience psychotic-like symptoms and my doctor pulled me back to 40mg. I dont feel like its doing anything for me anymore and I often find myself staring... just zoned out. You will always need more of this drug over time for it to actually work. It is highly addictive. I cant get out of the bed without it. It used to be my ""wonder drug"" in the beginning. I felt better and worked harder and smarter than I'd ever dreamed possible. Now I suffer with severe anxiety and cant focus on anything for very long. It causes irritability and keeps me from eating regular meals. But I am addicted to the energy it gives me and just today I told my psychiatrist not to take me off of it even though I have such bad anxiety. He isn't the same doctor that once prescribed 120mg. He really thinks I should come off of it. Deep down
column3: I believe I should too. Sometimes
column4: even on just 40mg I feel so wired. My eyes dilate
column5: my hands are always cold and I shake. I have to take Lunesta 3mg to go to sleep at every night. I will say that Adderall XR was only a short-lived fix for me. I have never been hyperactive... just attention deficit. If you are taking it
column6: maybe you will have better results than I have."

column1: 479$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$11/23/2008 10:48:18 PM$Reviewer: juststartedadderall
column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $4$4$5$"So far I have only been on Adderall XR for about a week.  The only side affects I've noticed are it seems like it takes me longer to fall asleep at night.  I think the drug has helped me immensely
column3: I have been taking 20mg of Lexapro for about 4 years now and it has helped with my anxiety but my head always felt clouded
column4: I always felt like ""my get up and go got up and went"".  I was always just sluggish and wanting to nap all the time.  My attention span was always very short and I became bored with things very fast
column5: I was constantly punishing myself for daydreaming and trying to make myself focus.  The second day of being on Adderall XR was when I noticed the biggest differance
column6: and it has been the same since starting.  My thinking is SO MUCH clearer.  The constant ""background noise"" of continuous thoughts is gone.  I was afraid when I started the drug I would feel like I was on a caffeine overdose
column7: but it's not like that at all.  Your thoughts just clear
column8: I even speak slower
column9: I'm more focused on what is going on
column10: I don't even think about taking a nap anymore
column11: don't have a need to.  Things that I used to constantly procrastinate on just get finished.  Not only are you doing the things you didn't do before you have an enjoyment in doing them.  I have always felt that I was an anxious child growing up and I think that A LOT of my anxiety problems as an adult were definitely related to my ADHD.  So far I can't say anything bad about Adderall XR.  I take one 25mg capsule in the morning
column12: eat breakfast and go about my day.  The only other medications I take are a multivitamin and a fish oil supplement at lunch and Lexapro 20mg before bed.  I would highly recommend Adderall XR especially if you have anxiety and depression.  Good luck to all. "

column1: 494$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$10/22/2008 12:28:25 AM$Reviewer: AddictTotalAddict
column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $5$2$5$"Addiction. That about sums it up. Too much of a good thing. It was typical. It made me feel great. It made me feel as though life was worth living. I wrote
column3: I focused
column4: I read
column5: then before I knew it
column6: the crash would hit. And I would pop another one. At one point
column7: I was up for FIVE DAYS with NO FOOD. Things start to go down hill on day 2. You can't focus as well
column8: your nerves are shot. You are weak. But man
column9: when that exhaustion hits
column10: it's so scary. I did this off and on for months until one day my doctor said
column11: ""No more."" This was because I finally told him
column12: ""Im out and I feel like I'm dying!"" I was taken off large doses 60-80mg a day for 4 months COLD TURKEY. I was out early. And this time I told him. I could not take it. I hard trouble just moving from the bed to to bathroom.I was SEVERELY depressed to the point of suicidal thoughts. I slept 23 hours a day for five days. My tolerance was though the roof. I could take 80 mg in the morning just to feel ""normal."" Finally a doctor took mercy on me and cut my dose down to 20 mg a day with the explicit understanding my mother would be doling them out to me. I weaned off them gradually. Finally down to 5 mg a day. The withdrawals from this drug when it abused is nothing short of the definition of hell. Exhaustion is complete and total. You are NON FUNCTIONAL.  It's hard to give it a rating because my addictive mind abused the hell out of it. If you have any history of substance abuse STAY CLEAR! WORST DRUG I EVER ABUSED AND I DID JUST ABOTU ALL OF THEM!"

column1: 516$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$9/9/2008 2:24:26 AM$Reviewer: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $4$5$5$Excellent drug that has helped me dramatically.  The trick is getting the dosage correct.  Too low of a dose kept me up for 24 hours

column3: but I can see how it could be difficult for a child to handle this medication.  I am not saying that I would not give it to a child
column4: but I would be careful.  I am a 165lb
column5: 38 yr old male and a 20mg xr dose is perfect for me. The medication works differently on everyone
column6: but I could not imagine 60-90 mg daily. I am sure there are some that need it
column7: but I would never give a child that kind of dose. Best of luck to you

column3: EEG's etc..).  Homework went from 3-4 hrs. to 1-2hrs. and it's done correctly! Most of the time he's done it all before he gets home. The side effects I've noticed are dry mouth and sometimes he's irritable with his 6 year old sister and he used to be extremely tolerant (it actually seems more normal now). He's lost 4lbs but he can afford it because he was 77lbs. I was worried about the slow growth side effect
column4: but he grew 1 in. since he started. I'm just not sure if I want him to take it during summer months or maybe I won't give it to him on the weekends.  This is something I'll discuss with his doctor.  It definetly works
column5: it's just one of those things you wish you didn't have to do."

574$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$2/23/2008 9:53:15 PM$Reviewer: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $5$5$5$I began taking adderall xr 20mg after 3 or 4 years of difficulty concentrating.  I had to do something about it
column2: since i began to fail classes in college because i couldn't sit down long enough to study. (I got straight-A's in high school). Adderall helps ENORMOUSLY.  I have had a complete turn-around.  I get all of my homework done

column1: 576$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$2/11/2008 8:40:06 PM$Reviewer: cuddles96

The doctor prescribed adderall xr 25 mg which is ok for his weight.  It was a nightmare.  The side effects were horrible.  My son was paranoid all day
column3: aggitated
column4: crying
column5: hullisinating
column6: anxiety
column7: couldn't make decisions or stop talking.  It was the worst.  We took him to the emergency room and they couldn't do anything for him.  Just had to give him plenty of fluids.  It didn't wear off till 10:00 that night.  While in the hospital the dr told me another child two weeks ago had the same reaction.  I wouldn't recommend this drug to anyone.  It was a total nightmare.  And there was nothing i could do to help him.

column1: 577$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$2/11/2008 12:00:32 PM$Reviewer: $4$1$4$"This medication can have some serious side effects that aren't clearly stated in any of the literature. My 9 year old nephew developed a stomach ulcer after less than a year on this medication.
Also
column2: it has some wicked withdrawal symptoms if you discontinue it's use without weaning off. Causing symptoms typical of withdrawal such as anxiety
column3: chills
column4: sweating
column5: vomiting and diarhea."

column1: 578$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$2/7/2008 9:51:56 AM$Reviewer: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $5$5$5$"I was diagnosed with ADD when I was 6 years old. I went thru lots of tests and many trips to the psychiatrist. (Can be very terrifying for a 6 year old)I started taking Ritalin for about 8 years. When I entered high school I started taking Adderall XR 20 mg. I love this medication. It’s very easy to take. I feel satisfied with my work ethic and I constantly have my eye on the ball. The only thing I find hard is
column2: I have a problem with socializing while on the medication. It’s hard for me to have conversations that aren’t related to work. Guess you can say that I'm in the ZONE. (Not trying to freak any one out but is basically legal “speed”) I don't eat much either. I only take Adderall Monday-Friday. I used to take it everyday but I felt as if I were in a ""coma"" like state. Sometimes I'll forget to take my med. before work and what a HUGE difference I'm very sensitive
column3: and I feel like I can eat a horse. My family
column4: friends and co-workers know about my disorder. I don't feel embarrassed about it; it’s a part of me that I can’t control."

column1: 579$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$2/6/2008 11:28:55 PM$Reviewer: el Bee
column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $4$3$5$"I was diagnosed ONE day before a consultant decided to change my job from interesting to  BOR-ing.  Hearing this
column3: my Dr. decided to begin with one 30mg dose of AdderallXR first thing in the morning and 30mg at noon.  As I attempted to perform the boring tasks of my ""new"" job--anxiety increased so high it seemed I would snap in two--thus
column4: I resigned.

column1: At this
column2: my Dr. switched me to one 30mg XR and one generic non-extended release of 10mg at noon.  The anxiety lessened and I found I could focus on things like never before (the bad side is
column3: sometimes I focus on things I DON'T NEED to do and hours pass as I search the web as I was doing just now).

column1: While on the 60mg XR
column2: even though I experienced a heightened level of anxiety
column3: I did an experiment and for the first time in my LIFE
column4: I was actually able to make an outline
column5: a REAL outline for a speech!  As a public speaker
column6: this is pretty important.

column1: One strange side effect--before Adderall
column2: I had stopped biting my nails and now I can't keep from chewing and ripping at them.  I have to glue on plastic nails to stop.  Also
column3: I can't seem to fall asleep before about 1:30 AM
column4: even if I take it at 7AM. But OFF of this drug
column5: I used to feel lethargic almost all day and perk up at night
column6: and on this dose
column7: I have no more lethargy and I never nap at all during the day--I actually feel like a normal
column8: thinking human being.  I wonder
column9: what could be wrong with that
column10: even if it IS addictive?  I'm not sure.

column1: Honestly
column2: It's as if it connected those pieces of my 52 year-old brain that were never connected before...Adderall is not perfect--sometimes I have menopausal episodes of angst that are exacerbated by taking this stimulant
column3: but even my husband noticed a marked change.  I am more ""real"" on this mind-assisting additive than not.

column1: Angst and nail-biting aside
column2: it's as if it has helped me find who I really am--helped my frontal lobe behave normally.  I don't want to go backward in processing information. It's so much better now... "

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Caregiver) $5$5$5$My 7 yr. old son was diagnosed about 1 1/2 yrs. ago with ADHD. We started out with Concerta which worked for a month
column3: but we never saw a great improvement with his symptoms. He has been on Adderall for over a year and fianally last month we reached peak satisfaction. This drug is great
column4: but ADHD is a disease that you constantly have to monitor and keep in close contact with your health care provider. His dosage over a year has increased from 10-25 milligrams. So
column5: if you are like me and expect that a miracle will occur and symtoms resolve after a short period of time
column6: do not give up
column7: things will gradually improve and then one day you look at your child and realize that he no longer has significant symptoms of ADHD. My son no longer gets in trouble at school and has been on the A honor roll for quite some time. Adderall has been a wonderful choice for my child.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$5$I was diagnosed with ADD in 3rd grade. I was put on Ritalin and it was not good for me. I was rediagnosed and given adderall. My grades improved from mostyl C's to A's and B's. A positive side effect: I would take it as soon as I got up in the morning and it made it easy for me to make it to early classes. I did experience dry mouth but it wasnt intolerable. Once in a while I would have trouble sleeping but some people say they sleep better on this because their thoughts dont race before bed. As for mood swings I didnt experience any. Some people might have said I wasn't as cheery but it was because I was so focused on getting something done I didnt have time to be distracted. I consider this a good thing. I did like the XR pills better. I have been off of my meds for 2 years and feel I should get back onto it for my job.

column1: 635$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$9/23/2007 2:44:18 PM$Reviewer: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $5$5$5$I have ADD
column2: not ADHD.  I noticed a difference in my cognitive abilities almost immediately after using Adderall XR.  The 30 mg capsule made my heart race
column3: so my dosage was reduced to 25 mg. The ideal dose for me would probably be somewhere in between 25 mg and 30 mg. My symptoms gradually worsened over a period of 30+ years and resulted in multiple job losses
column4: divorces and financial difficulties.  I was not accurately diagnosed until age 45
column5: although I had virtually all of the classic ADD symptoms dating back to childhood.  About 5 or 6 years ago I actually wondered if I had some type of learning disability because I could not process a complete thought
column6: could not retain spoken information or instructions
column7: was unable to concentrate on any task
column8: etc. Although I discussed this concern with my psychiatrist at the time
column9: there was no mention of the possibility of ADD.  I was given additional medication to treat my existing anxiety & depression
column10: which did nothing to improve my ADD symptoms. However
column11: on my first visit with a new psychiatrist several years later
column12: I was given the diagnosis of ADD.  Of course
column13: it would have been great to have been accurately diagnosed and treated years ago
column14: but I am grateful to have found help at all.  I could have spent the rest of my life suffering if not for someone new taking a fresh look at my case.

column5: still happens now). I would get random rashes that would start looking like a ant bite and spread till it vanised i thought it was something wrong with me so i separated my self fell deep into depression until i dropped out of school 2007 and stopped taking the medicine. After about 6 years those rashes slowed down still stuggle eating socially awkward (don't know how to handle socializing at work) still have to urinate every 20-30 min (interferes with my jobs to many breaks) i was a kid whos school had my mom put me on the medicine i didn't pay for it but i was a kid effected by the medicine and the #LABEL of ADHD and the #Process of #ADHD

column1: 646$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$12/6/2018 2:09:38 AM$Reviewer: MrCook
column2: 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $5$5$5$"I struggled to concentrate my whole life. I was called a ""high aptitude/low achiever"". ""If he would just buckle down and do the work...his mind wanders...he refuses to get his work done. He's unprepared...he always has an excuse... He's disorganized."" I heard these comments from everyone. I frustrated my teachers
column3: my parents and myself. I couldn't pay attention. School was a nightmare that seemed to last forever. I couldn't wait for each class to end. Yet I would do well on tests. I'd get terrible grades for class participation and homework assignments
column4: but then I would get an A or a B on midterms and finals and end up with a B or a C in the course. In college I discovered amphetamines
column5: which are much stronger than Adderall but had the same effect on my ability to concentrate. I'd be failing a course all semester
column6: skipping classes
column7: losing my homework
column8: etc.
column9: but then I'd get some ""speed"" and learn the entire course from the book in a couple of days and ace the final. I was accused of cheating once because professor didn't believe I could have learned so much in such a short period. I was self-medicating
column10: but I didn't know it. There was no such thing as ADD or ADHD in the 60's and 70'. I thought there was something wrong with me and I was wrong to take amphetamines. I couldn't take them all the time; the side effects were extreme. After college
column11: I had to accept mediocrity in almost everything
column12: but I got by. At 50
column13: a shrink finally recognized my ADHD and prescribed Adderall. One of the best days of my life. No more antidepressants
column14: no more confusion and no more procrastination and mediocre achievement. The fog had lifted. My life is so much better in every way. I've learned to accept that where I am today is the culmination of everything I've ever done. I can't regret that because I am happier now than I've ever been. Medical science has saved me. My newfound ability to think and act rationally has made it so I can help others through this sometimes confusing life.

column1:

648$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$10/13/2018 7:49:21 PM$Reviewer: Darby1, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $5$5$5$I was misdiagnosed for the first 17 years of my life
column2: I was forced to take antidepressants that scared me and didn't work. I failed at everything. I would have emotional outbursts from being so overwhelmed. I saw so many doctors and counselors I felt like I was broken and no one was able to ""fix"" me. As I grew up I learned ways to manage my symptoms but it was exhausting. If i was succeeding at any point it always ended with failure or side tracked resulting in countless unfinished things that made me feel incompetent. ""Jack of all trades; master at none"". I knew I was capable of so much more but the distractions of hearing
column3: seeing
column4: feeling
column5: smelling everything in my environment all at the same time made me dizzy and I couldn't sort it all out. It wasnt until a little over a year ago I began therapy
column6: seeing a wonderful Psychiatrist who UNDERSTOOD ME! For the first time in my life i was reassured i wasnt alone. Apprehensively I began taking this medicine
column7: it took over 6 months to start feeling in control of my mind
column8: but now I have it figured out. Instead of hearing music
column9: I am listening to the instruments. I can single out the drummer and follow his beats to the end. I am maintaining a high GPA in college
column10: I am organized
column11: efficient and I no longer feel like a crack in the sidewalk of life. I hate that people without a diagnosis
column12: who aren't struggling are abusing this medicine that helps so many people function at high capacity who truly need it! The biggest draw back for me is seeing what I could've done years ago but didn't. I have noticed my heart rate goes up spontaneously which can be scary
column13: but it does pass. I have to learn to give myself credit for my successes
column14: I am not my medication or ADHD but they have both added to the positives of who I am. If you have been struggling
column15: reach out!"

column1: 650$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$3/24/2018 6:22:44 AM$Reviewer: CLBK
column2: 55-64 on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $5$5$5$I was fortunate to have a Doctor that asked questions and diagnosed me in my 40's. If I had been diagnosed earlier my life would have been better. I take Adderall 30 mg XL capsules and it changed my life. I feel normal! For my treatment this form and dosage works great. I take it about an hour before I'll be getting up and I'm able to function and stay focused at my job and at home. It doesn't make me jittery or hyper
column3: doesn't take my appetite away ( I often wish it would!) I still occasionally need a nap during the day and have no problem falling asleep at night. I've always had low blood pressure
column4: low body temperature
column5: and low blood sugar but they tell me my thyroid levels are fine. I used to get a lot of migraines and had to have Imitrex Nasal with me all the time. Now I very seldom need it. For me personally Adderall has been a life saver! I take it as directed
column6: don't abuse it
column7: see my doctor regularly and can live a productive life. I've been on it for about ten years now
column8: I'm female and 60 years old.

column1: 651$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$3/4/2018 9:30:37 PM$Reviewer: Ize
column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $5$5$5$"Made college a possibility for me. I was able to focus and perform well in my classes. Before that I had been failing but knew I could do more than my grades were showing. Over the years (17 or so I believe) I have remained on the same dose with no side effects. I have since been promoted at work and although I am struggling to learn time management on a whole new level I suspect that is normal and not due to ADHD. I continue to take my medication to maintain a level of ""normal"" cognative function like everyone else. Otherwise everything that crossed my mind would cross my lips and I couldn't keep my emotions in check. I would easily be overwhelmed by projects or anything that involved multiple steps and people depending on me. I would wilt under the pressure. Adderall allows me the ability to focus my thoughts and slow my mental process down. Filter the thousand bits of input I'm bombardrd with every moment. I can see the forrest through the leaves... This medication has been pivotal to my success and I was able to stop taking antidepressants after being on Adderall. I finally felt normal. Hopefully my review helps put a parent at ease when considering if they should put their child on Adderall or not. "

column2: 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $5$5$5$"Adderall makes me feel normal.

column1: Without it I space out
column2: have trouble prioritizing and getting around to doing what I need to do
column3: and can't function as an adult. Before I started taking it I would pick fights (arguments) in order to get my adrenalin to go up so I could do things. Now I'm even-keeled all day long (and have learnt to space out dosage through the day in order to be even-keeled).

column1: I never take more than what I've been prescribed (60mg) and depending on the day I can function well on as little as 40mg.  This blue pill has changed my life. I've been on the same prescription for almost 20 years now.
I once took too much and felt bad but it didn't feel like a ""high"".  If I wanted to get high Aderall would be the last thing I would take
column2: because all it does is to make me normal.

column1: Note I have the Inactive diagnosis of ADHD meaning I was never hyperactive. I retreated into my inner world and spaced out instead.
Hope this helps others like me.

674$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$4/1/2016 12:33:18 PM$Reviewer: Smalloni, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Caregiver) $3$1$1$My son was changed from Ritalin to Adderall at age 13. After a short while of being on Adderall he became very angry and defiant. We thought that since he was going through puberty & dealing with ADHD that he was just having a rough time dealing with the chemistry changing in his body. As time went on he became more aggressive threatening to stab his father with a butcher knife & constantly going up against his dad & peers at school. He distroyed things in his path & punched holes in the walls of our home, yelling & cursing when anyone rubbed him the wrong way. The slightest things would set him off into fits of rage. He took on multiple personalities one being very evil as if Satan's son. He was a Jeckyll & Hyde.  This went on for 4 years as the dosage was increased because of his high tolerance to Adderall. After being in support groups & reading up I discovered other we're experiencing these very same side affects. I demanded the doctor to take him off of it and since he's been off of it for 6 months now & almost instantly I got my sweet boy back. I read that Adderall was like taking crystal meth. This medicine needs to be removed from the market permanently in my opinion. He was in & out of the hospital 4 times in a 3 months time frame. Not once had the doctors ever try taking him off the Adderall. All they did was ginnea pig him pumping him full of antipsychotic meds. He ended up for the first time in his life getting in trouble with the police for assault on an officer, resisting arrest & interfering with police business. Adderall is a very dangerous medication. If you benefit from it without the bad side affects, then that is good. If not, I would not take this medication.

774$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$6/20/2014 10:00:56 PM$Reviewer: Alex, 19-24 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $5$5$5$I was on Strattera for about 5 years and switching to adderall has been one of the best decisions i've made. Adderall is essentially like taking 10 red bulls. It can work for longer periods, but the biggest bonus is the quality of work that I can produce. The reason being, adderall gives me the ability to be able to be much more focused on the material and as a result, I retain it better. There is a downside however. If taken too late in the day, it can keep you awake and sometimes you can feel a bit overstimulated. Another thing to watch for may be a slight change in behaviour. I had family members that hadn't seen me in several months tell me that I seemed too stimulated during regular conversation. In terms of dosage, I personally found 20mg to be more than enough but this varies from person to person. Overall my experience has been great, it has helped me bridge that gap that has kept me from performing like the rest of the students in my classes.

779$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$6/4/2014 10:21:56 AM$Reviewer: mandyslayton, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$5$I have been taking adderall xr for almost 3 years now.
It has changed my life for the better.
I am a 35 year old female who my parents didn't believe in me taking drugs like this as a child.I knew I had issues in high school
and I know for a fact had I been on this medication I would have done better in school
and would have cared about going to college.

I finally did something for myself when I turned 30 and went to a psychiatrist. It took a few different medications(concerta/vyvanse) before my Dr put me on Adderall. One made me so dizzy and one made my heart race.
I can see getting addicted
column2: but I knew with the way I live my life
column3: I wouldn't have to worry.

column1: I had major issues staying focused and awake no matter how much sleep I would get. I would get bored easily or start a dozen different tasks and not get one completed. I had no time management.
I started with 20mg and I take it in the am when I wake up at 6 am. It makes me want to do my job and not get stressed. I am much more
organized. It keeps my life on track.
I started getting headaches about 3 months in and just really tired again by 3 pm. When I went to my dr for a check up she decided to
try a half of a 20mg of plain adderall at 2pm.
It did the trick and I've been on this combination ever since and haven't had to change anything.
I go to bed by 10:30 or 11 pm. I hardly ever have trouble sleeping.  My heart doesn't race either.
A plus for me was it helped lose the weight from having my daughter a few years prior. I gained 70lbs and wasn't worried about losing
the last 30lbs but it was an added plus.
I don't have such an appetite loss like I did when I first started.
It helps me with portion control and I don't stuff my face like I used to before I started the medication.
It also helps me have normal bowel movements and regular.
I will tell you if I have to stay up later I do end up irritable and get quiet and just want to crash. That's about the only side effect I've experienced.

column1:
796$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$4/22/2014 10:17:58 AM$Reviewer: AdderallForADHD, 13-18 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $5$4$2$I gave this medication a 2 out of 5 for Ease of Use because I have had a few issues with dosage size and perscription. When I lost a significant amount of weight (due to health changes - NOT the medication), my Dr. thought it might be best to alter my medication system, and for the next year my dose and brand was shuffled around, as a result every pharmacist in town thinks I am some cartel drug dealer. But once on the right dose for your body, Adderall is incredible for those with Attention Deficit. It will not cause shakiness or nervousness. It will have a calming effect while in your system. I can generally think much more clearly and am able to multi-task. If you need Adderall, it will work for you and you will NOT have the same reaction to it as someone taking speed. The medication for someone with ADHD will slow you, in a sense: making it clear and possible to make simple, rational decisions without struggle and giving you the ability to channel your energy and focus on what you need. I take 2 25mg XRs throughout the day, and have an optional add on of 10mg instant release for if I have a lot of homework or my XR wears off (I am a student, and mostly use the extra during exams or if I am writing a last minute essay the night before). I am an 18y/o 115 lb girl and pretty skinny, and this is the dose that works well for me (it deffinately isn't the same for everyone). The only problem I have found with Adderall is that on nights I take the optional 10mg, I have some trouble sleeping. But it's alright, because I don't take it often and usually if I do I need to stay awake that night anyways. However, if you do not have to pull frequent all-nighters, I would recommend never taking Adderall within  4 hours of your bedtime. Other than that, Adderall has provided me with the ability to focus in class, on my friends, after school, and accomplish the things I need to do, without ever getting too distracted or forgetting what I had to do.

817$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$3/17/2014 12:18:10 AM$Reviewer: adderall593, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$1$1$Please practice extreme caution when using this drug.  The first time I used it I became hooked and went to the doctor to get a prescription right away.  It was not long after that I developed a dependence that turned into an addiction, and an inability to do anything while off of the drug.  I started at 20 mg, and three years later, have to take 40-60mg to get the same effects, but the side effects are completely dreadful....intense mood swings, depression, insomnia, etc.  I just did not feel like myself, but it was still so hard to stop taking the drug.  I still take it once in a while because I have a rigorous class schedule and studying without it is almost impossible.  I am definitely a different person when I'm on it and feel that it has brought more negative than positive experiences into my life. Although not all people will have negative experiences and/or become addicted, this drug can ruin your life.

column2: Paxil

column9: my Pain Management doctor

He said he is willing to prescribe it for me if there should ever be a reason I stop requiring the services of the doctor who prescribes it for me now.  I have been under treatment with the same psychiatrist for 12 years and he agrees that this medicine has been the best prescription for improving my depression and dealing with other very complicated issues in my life. column3: and the only apparent notice side effects I have had are rapid heart beat
column4: hyper talkative (when I am around people).  About a year ago
column5: I noticed that I was having mild to moderate facial ticks (rapid blinking
column6: nose tick gestures)
column7: etc.  I have know for many years that I have a very mild case of Tourette's Syndrome
column8: but for some reason
column9: the Adderall seems to have brought out those symptoms after two years
column10: and not sure why this is happening.  When taking Adderall
column11: I feel normal
column12: active
column13: hopeful and at my full potential -- and I have incredible focus at work.  When I don't take Adderall
column14: I feel just the opposite; lethargic
column15: depressed
column16: and kind of generally overwhelmed with life.  My question is this
column17: has any one else out there that also has Tourette's Syndrome
column18: found a good remedy for this.  A combination drug with Adderall?  A smaller dosage of Adderall?  Currently
column19: I take a 30mg generic
column20: and it is called ""Amphetamine Salts ER 30 mg Cap""
column21: manufactured by Teva/Barr.  I really hate to quit taking this
column22: but near the end of the half life of the dose
column23: the tourrette's syndrome symptoms are getting to the point where it is almost not worth taking.  Any feedback or input would be helpful and beneficial."

904$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$9/25/2013 1:49:15 PM$Reviewer: scdmella, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $4$3$3$I have taken both adderallxr and Adderall ir. I like the long lasting version better. There are good and bad effects from the medicine. The good is that you get things done, even if you don't want to. It also suppresses my appetite which is good as I tend to overeat. The bad effects: sometimes I hyper focus or focus too much on the wrong things like playing video games on my ipad or phone. Also, it used to make me want to smoke cigarettes for some reason. I have quit, but I do use e cigs sometimes. Also, I tend to pick at my skin if I am really tired and have taken Adderall. I don't notice a come down most of the time as other people have mentioned. One last thing. I forget that I need to drink water while taking Adderall, because I never get thirsty while on Adderall which is odd. But if I don't hydrate myself, I end up getting a headache .
