column1: 927$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$8/11/2013 10:25:56 AM$Reviewer: Thankful
column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$5$"I came to this site today to review opinions between ""Brand"" and generic Adderrall and thought I should add my personal experience with this medication.

column1: I was diagnosed with depression 14 years ago and was prescribed Paxil. After six months of little change in my condition
column2: I was prescribed Prozac and Xanax. Over the next few years
column3: my conditioned worsened. I was eventually prescribed Ambien for insomnia
column4: which was a huge mistake.

column1: I became addicted to Ambien
column2: not for the sleep benefits but for the Utopian feeling it provided me. I would take it several times during the day
column3: and quickly began running out of my prescriptions. This led to ""Doc Shopping
column4: and eventually I had three doctors writing me scripts every month.

column1: Long story short: my marriage fell apart
column2: I couldn't hold a job and I reached a point where I didn't care whether I lived or died.

column1: Three years ago
column2: I made an appt. with a young doctor at a university research facility. After describing my medical history and my current condition
column3: he said he believed I suffered from adult ADD. He started me on 10 mg of Adderall daily.

column1: Within two months
column2: I was completely off my depression meds (Cymbalta and Tofrenil) and had no desire whatsoever for the Ambien.

column1: I have now been taking 30 mg daily for the past year
column2: and am experiencing no addictive drug behavior whatsoever. I was also a daily drinker
column3: and now only drink 1-2 glasses of wine on the weekends. I have held a steady
column4: professional-level job for over three years now
column5: and my marriage has been restored.

column1: Through the grace of God
column2: I was led to a doctor who literally saved my life. This amazing drug has helped make all the difference. If you have been diagnosed with depression and nothing seems to help
column3: you may want to discuss this with your doctor."

983$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$4/13/2013 9:08:03 AM$Reviewer: Horrible for Family,Awesome for Business, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $3$1$5$I worked my way up to 60-80mg daily for the year I took adderall. It was alot like making a deal with the devil.  YOU WILL BE SUCCESSFUL AT WHAT YOU DO.  YOU WILL GET ADDICTED.  It will stop working the same and u will not get the benifits u once received.  Coming down is not fun.  I started drinking everynight to even out my moods at night.  If not I would get very aggitated and angry.  I made well over a million dollars in the last year, but every emotional/personal issue took a back seat.  Do not take Adderall if you have a family.  You will regret it.
984$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$4/8/2013 7:32:08 PM$Reviewer: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $5$5$5$I get sleepy after I take it, but it works on me very well.
985$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$4/8/2013 8:24:04 AM$Reviewer: Onslo, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $5$4$5$Wonder drug ! I wish I had it when I was in school. I was labeled as a problem kid. Lazy,  always  in trouble. In the remedial classes in most subjects. Could not pay attention to things that were not interesting to me. Age 44 is when I was given my first dose of adderall. My kids were taking it for ADD. My doctor was treating me with anti depressants with no real results. He gave me a simple test to take in his office. Switched me to adderall to see if things in my life improved. With in just a few days I noticed Hugh improvements in my life. I was able to do things that I could never do before. Like understanding what I had just read, being able to focus on things that were always a challenge to me,so I avoided them. I could understand new concepts and enjoyed learning for the first time in my life. Before I struggled with following basic instructions and would get frustrated and just give up.  For me it was a new life that I could enjoy and be present and be part of things I was scared to get involved in. For fear that others would think I was slow or challenged. Adderall change my whole life for the better. I wonder where I would be today if I had been given this drug in my early school years. I own a very successfully catering business and I'm happy with my life. I will always wonder what I could have accomplished if I was given the right treatment when I was in school. 
986$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$4/1/2013 7:35:53 AM$Reviewer: peach, 45-54 Female  (Patient) $4$4$4$been on it 1 week for severe untreatable depression.  has been working great.

As a nurse working nights on a very busy floor that I truly Love & Self Employed Auto Dealership
column2: I became more & more scatter brained & stressed due to the inability to stay focused.  Adderall has made life so much better
column3: in that I can focus & get things done as I once did with out all the stress & un organized state of mind.  It has not caused me to have weight loss
column4: infact I have gained & maintain with difficulty to loose weight.  I sleep well when I do sleep & it is just such a miracle drug for me.  I notice when I have taken vacations from it
column5: I can not think for myself & I can NOT stay still long enough  when trying to sit at my desk to get work done.   I am very concerned about the ability to get COMPLETELY off this drug & function as I should.  Haven't got that far yet but will surely let you know when or if I do.   Important need of Adderral for me is that is slows me down MENTALLY so that I can properly function & think as I should in orders to focus & concentrate on very important & large amounts of work.  I was told by my doctor I was a TRUE canidate for this drug & I must agree.  I have Never been on any medication in my life.  This is the first & I am 51 years old.

989$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$4/8/2013 12:39:46 PM$Reviewer: 13-18 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $3$2$5$I only took adderall for about four months before I had to stop. It worked wonders of my focus is school and controlled my hyperactivity really well for the most part, but the side effects were just too much. Heart palpitations, no appetite whatsoever and nausea, but the worst by far was the anxiety. I would have four or five panic attacks a week just from tiny things like homework, and it drove me crazy. I ended up switching medications a couple months ago, and I'm doing much better now. These meds work great but DO NOT take them if you have a fast heart rate to begin with or are already prone to worrying/anxiety.

1008$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$2/20/2013 3:50:55 PM$Reviewer: head injury, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$3$5$Taking Adderall (generic)10mg 2st month and 20 mg 2nd month I begain losing my hair and my eyelashes were falling out (quite noticeable).  I stopped using it for a a couple of months (in between used ritalin [generic not as effective with focus and concentration] and my eyelashes grew back and my hair was not back to where it was before I started taking aderall but it stopped thinning, I was having nightmares and evil dreams, my eyes were so dried that I would wake up in pain in the middle of the night and have to put eye drops in, constipation, and racing thoughts.  I started taking the NAME BRAND Adderall a few months afterwards because I thought maybe the side effects were from the fillers because I am very sensitive to some medications.  I was able to concentrate and focus and become a normal person but again, slowly but surely, my eyelashes started to fall out and my eyes were dry but not as bad as on the generic brand--the dry eyes I could have tolerated, but I had to stop the Adderall or lose my hair on my head and eyelashes. Aside from the hair loss, I would have stayed on the NAME BRAND Adderall.  It was like I had chemotherapy and my hair was falling out.
1009$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$2/14/2013 6:21:24 PM$Reviewer: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $5$5$5$While I was initially skeptical of taking this medication because of my professional life (I'm an active-duty commissioned officer in the United States Air Force) I must admit that this mdication has changed my life. Not only was this medication life-changing, it only took hours for me to realize the bennifits of the treatment in terms of subsidence of my ADHD symptoms. While others have experienced problems with Adderall and its generic forms, I would HIGHLY RECOMMEND anyone suffering with serious, life-altering ADHD symptoms (as I was) consult your primary care physican or mental health care provider and see if this is an option for you. Believe me, I understand the challenges associated with both the stigma associated with ADHD generally and this medication specifically, but I promise that if this treatment is as effective for you as it was for me you'll kick yourself for waiting so long to try it (just like I did)!

column1: 1067$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$11/8/2012 10:02:33 AM$Reviewer: rewindmind
column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$4$5$"Adderall has helped me focus and actually complete a task or a 'to do' list. Can't believe what a difference it makes. My husband used to 'poo-poo' me...you are lazy
column3: just focus
column4: why can't you get anything done? I thought I was losing my mind. Was tested for ADD/ADHD by a psychiatric doctor who said I was anxious and depressed and prescribed Xanax....that made me sleepy and more disconnected.

column1: Finally found a nurse practitioner who recognized my symptoms right away. Sitting in her office
column2: I couldn't even keep my feet/legs still....always felt as if I needed to be doing something!! Within three days
column3: I couldn't believe the difference. I can focus at work
column4: I can listen to a conversation without having my mind race at all the 'things' I need to complete. Just wish I would have had this in college...a lot of my professors thought I was just a scatterbrain...

column1: One of the best commercials on TV was my ah-ha moment. A woman is sitting in a conference room--in a meeting with many others. The camera focuses on her face and she has thoughts racing through her mind
column2: the announcer says...""her mind is like a television that can't find the right channel"" shows constantly changing channels/commercials...Oh my...that is me...!! I knew I needed to find someone to help me. If this sounds like you...search until you find a health care provider that will listen. The first doc I saw
column3: made me think there was something seriously wrong with me
column4: even after all the ADHD tests. The Nurse Practitioner diagnosed me at the first visit.

column1: I have no issues with this medication
column2: no shaking or nervousness...the opposite effect actually. One complaint
column3: it is amphetamine  salts...there is a 'salty' taste in my mouth--occasionally. I drink lots of water during the day
column4: that seems to help. "

1086$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$10/5/2012 3:36:05 AM$Reviewer: If I only knew, 19-24 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $5$4$5$As a child I never really knew that i had a short attention span. I've always had a hard time in school, but I really noticed it whenever I got into college. No matter how much I studied I couldn't seem to retain any information. About a year ago I went to my doctor and found out I have ADD. I never knew I had it until I looked back at my childhood and all the way to me now as an adult. I was put on adderall 20mg twice a day my life actually became normal. For the first time in my life I actually heard a clock ticking while talking to family. My ability to stay focused and on task was just the best feeling in the world. My life has very organized and I can hold interest in studying, my work, as well as my social life. The only downfall about adderall was that it had an extreme supression of my appetite and I had no extra weight to lose. After I would come down off of my doseage I get very irritable, not sure if it's a side effect from the drug or the fact I work 3rd shift as a police officer and rarely sleep good. But overall this has been a blessing to me and my ability to do better at work and at home. If I only had this when I was a young kid and in school I believe my grades would have been out of this world!

1090$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$9/25/2012 11:56:24 PM$Reviewer: honeygirl, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $4$4$4$I am prescribed Adderal 20mg per day In July I began taking the generic form D Amphetamine Salt Combo for cost effectiveness.  I was drug tested and the results showed positive for 97% D Methamphetamine isonomer and 3% L Methamphetamine isonomer. 4872 Amphetamine and 1872 Methamphetamine. I have researched and came to the conclusion that the generic DAmphetamine Salt Combo is the causitive factor compared to the Amphetamine(Adderal). I need documentation to support to save my licensure. My employment agency has my current prescription on file stating Adderal 20mg (generic ok). Please assist. I found no clinical difference between brand and generic and the efficacy is amazing.
1092$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$9/26/2012 11:54:36 PM$Reviewer: RufusTFirefly, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $4$3$3$I use the medication on a PRN basis, or more steadily at times...it takes a while to adjust to with insomnia as main side-effect.
1093$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$9/29/2012 7:36:03 PM$Reviewer: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$1$5$I've been prescribed 20mg of Adderall IR 3 times daily since I was 15, and I'm almost 20 now. Up until a year ago, it helped A LOT. I suddenly got good grades, more social, and felt great about myself. This past year, I noticed it wasn't giving me the same awesome effects. So, I started taking half of one extra, for that extra boost. Half of one became 4. Yes, I was taking 7 to 8 a day. This went on for about 9 months. My seasonal depression turned into major depressive disorder and I'm diagnosed with general anxiety disorder, chronic insomnia, major depression, mild schizophrenia, and amphetamine psychosis. Moral of my story: If you enjoy becoming addicted to a drug, seeing and hearing stuff, paranoid, depressed, aggressive, and losing everyone close to you, go for it. For everyone else, DO NOT TRY/USE ADDERALL!!! And if you do, for god's sake, DO NOT ABUSE IT! YOU'LL BECOME MENTALLY CRAZY.
1094$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$9/28/2012 1:01:43 AM$Reviewer: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $4$5$5$I was diagnosed with ADD (not ADHD) in early August 2012 when I finally decided to get checked out for it
column2: and I'm taking 10mg twice daily. The pros: I am now less ""socially awkward""
column3: I'm more motivated and concentrated
column4: it boosts my mood (which is a HUGE plus considering I have chronic depression)
column5: I feel confident in my abilities to do things
column6: and I enjoy things I once never enjoyed
column7: which was just about everything. The cons: weight loss (I don't realize I'm not eating because it depletes your appetite)
column8: strange ""crawling""/ itching sensation when I begin to come down from it at night (anyone else with this sensation? It's not listed anywhere as far as side effects go)
column9: almost impossible to fall asleep at night if I take it too late in the day.

column1: Although the cons may seem like more than the pros
column2: the cons are very tolerable and can be relieves such as taking a non habit forming sleep aid (Zzzquil works great!) and if you absolutely aren't hungry while taking it
column3: drink an ensure shake once a day or take vitamins daily to ensure you don't become malnourished
column4: (butter pecan flavored ensure tastes pretty good). It also has a habit of causing your body to develop a tolerance
column5: so if you want to avoid taking massive doses in the future
column6: I recommend going a day or two (or three!) without taking it. Specifically on days where you don't have to accomplish anything. This (should) help prevent developing a tolerance and make sure that you get the full effect. Overall
column7: I am very
column8: VERY happy with this medication."

column1: 1110$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$8/10/2012 12:50:58 PM$Reviewer: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $4$4$4$I've been taking Adderall for about 8yrs now and there's good news and bad news. Good news is that it works wonderfully in managing the symptoms. The bad news is that you have to watch how your appetite is affecting your eating habits
column2: usually you won't be hungry until the medicine wears off and you might find yourself malnourished if you're not careful. Also note that you can develop permanent 'tics' or compulsive repetitive behaviors. I have developed a tic of chewing on the side of my tongue. I am now pregnant and cannot take the medication for obvious reasons and yet I still chew on my tongue
column3: but that being said
column4: it isn't severe enough to prevent me from retaking it after my pregnancy because the ADHD is definitely worse than the side-effects of the Adderall. However
column5: every person is different so maybe for other people these 'tics' and appetite changes might not seem so minor. Overall though I have found it very useful and it has made a huge and mostly positive difference in my life
column6: so if you're thinking about trying it to treat your ADHD then I'd say go right ahead.

column1: 1156$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$4/29/2012 2:55:31 PM$Reviewer: Kristy
column2: 13-18 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $5$5$5$I've been taking Adderall since I was in 3rd grade for treatment for my ADHD. I am now a junior in high school and still take it daily for school. When I started taking Adderall it was the 5mg IR before school every day. A very low dosage for an 8 year old but it did help. Since then I changed to 10 mg ER somewhere in later middle school when I was either 13 or 14. Just this year I increased to 20 mg ER before school with 10 mg IR after school in order to help focus on homework. The adderall has been invaluable for me in helping me focus both during school and out
column3: as well as lowering my impulsivity since it gives me that second reaction time before I say something or do something I shouldn’t. The only side effect I’ve ever noticed is that I do have a decrease of appetite when on the pill and once it wears off I’m ravenously hungry. However
column4: once on the medication for 5 days or so that symptom has gone away and I end up hungry again. Overall I would recommend it to anyone with ADD or ADHD.

1186$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$2/12/2012 1:14:38 PM$Reviewer: BreezieBoo, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $5$5$5$To begin, I've never had an issue with addiction or drug abuse. I'm a college senior with a GPA of 3.6. I LOVE my classes and professors, but I can't pay attention as well as I wished. I found myself drinking insane amounts of coffee just to try and stay focused. I couldn't get through more than 4 pages in a book without having to reread it again. The worst part was, I had absolutely no motivation to do any schoolwork away from school (which used to not be a problem at all.) So, a few weeks ago, a classmate told me she was prescribed Adderall for the last 14 years, but stopped taking it, and selling it to make a quick buck. I had already researched ADD and ADHD and self diagnosed myself. I cut a 20mg pill in half, and didn't feel any difference at all. I waited a day or 2 and tried a full 20mg dose. 30 minutes later or so, I then found myself reading normally again, I was motivated to do things I had put off for weeks, I didn't get bored doing normal everyday things, and I didn't feel like I was moving at a million miles a minute (like I read people felt earlier.) I don't know when or if it even stopped working. I took it around 7pm and went to bed, no problem, at midnight (my typical bedtime) without any issues. I know that I don't HAVE to take it every day at all, but my days off when I want to just sleep and be lazy, I take  just ONE 20mg pill around noon after I have been up for a few hours, and I am far more productive than I have ever been in years. I'm not sure how to go about talking to a doctor about my self-diagnosis, or if there are any other similar medicines that could possibly be prescribed without the overly judged and criticized name Adderall attached to it. Not sure if that helps anyone, but I do see a positive change definitely. I wouldn't use it habitually or for an extended amount of time. 
1187$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$2/10/2012 9:04:53 AM$Reviewer: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$4$5$This helped me increase my focus and concentration tremendously... I once was at a standstill in College, always wanting class to be over, never paying attention, ditracted and over stimulated by the smallest noises; I would find myself obsessing about the tapping of a pencil, rather than the professor. As a result, my grades suffered, self-esteem suffered,  and I wanted to give up. I was prescribed adderall xr my sophomore year in College and I literally noticed a dramatic difference immediately. My grades went from a 2.4 and have remained at a 3.6. I do not recommend for long term use.

column2: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $4$4$3$"I get mixed feelings when it comes to Adderall. I'm a 25 y/o male that was diagnosed with ADHD 3 years ago. I took adderall (30mg
column3: 2x day) for the first 2 years and it worked well for the most part; there were two problems though. For one
column4: if you forget to take your second dose when you're supposed to
column5: you're going to notice...at least I did. Secondly
column6: god-forbid I took my morning dose on an empty stomach; I'd feel really jittery and my mind would race at 100mph. Overall though
column7: it did it's job. I ended up switching doctors at the VA (I'm a vet) and my new doc mentioned dexedrine. I was reluctant to try them
column8: but he put on me on 2x10mg spansules in the morning and 2x10mg tabs in the afternoon. Here I am a year later a lot happier with the results. The onset is smoother
column9: it's easier to eat on it and there are no ups-and-downs. I recommend looking into dexedrine for anyone who runs into these problems with adderall...Also
column10: dexedrine is a lot cheaper than adderall. Generic 10mg IR tabs cost about $.27 each
column11: while the 10mg spansules are 2.16each."

1250$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$11/21/2011 3:38:36 AM$Reviewer: SpeedFiend, 13-18 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$5$I have ADHD and I am prescribed 50mg vyvanse each day. It works well and I love it. Unfortunately, I love it so much I take well over the recommended daily dose. I have built my tolerance up to 350mg per day, and it makes me feel awesome. About a half hour after I pop them, my heart will start pounding and hurt incredibly. Often, when remaining still, my legs or arms will go numb. I feel dizzy and weak all the time. I will also get severe chest pain and back aches. I do not sleep, and if I do, I sleep at the most one hour during the day. Concerning eating habits, I don't eat much and have lost a lot of weight. My withdrawals are hell, and unexplainably miserable. I feel sad, tired, hungry, bored, and hopeless. I will admit that these pills possess most of my thoughts. If I don't have multiple pills on me at all times, I feel very uncomfortable. Therefore, I at least need to have pills on me for the next time I need to take some.

column1: 1307$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$9/13/2011 10:03:55 AM$Reviewer: dtathomas
column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$5$"I started Adderall-XR after my doctor ruled that I was ADHD
column3: which I was very reluctant to believe. I had a history of suicide attempts
column4: depression
column5: anxiety
column6: violence
column7: etc.
column8: which was attributed to a specific event  - being raped by our parish priest as a teenager at 13. The drug Adderall
column9: made it possible for me to be focused
column10: on task
column11: centered and a lot more accessible to psychological treatment which lasted almost 9 years. I am a much better person for doing the treatment
column12: I continue to take Adderall. It is the only ""psychological"" drug that I now take and was misdiagnosed for over 30 years. Work with your doctor to tweak this drug
column13: to the just right amount - you'll be glad you did. I am just one of the many that lived through a horrid
column14: tumultuous life in regards to the rape
column15: upbringing
column16: violence
column17: etc.
column18: and just trying to find the real me. A compassionate
column19: loving
column20: understanding and forgiving me buried deep under the ugly layers  of hell. I wrote a letter to my doctor and expressed the aforementioned and that he could read it to any patient that he desired - if he felt it would ""connect"" with that patient. My final words would be do not be afraid to ask questions
column22: get second opinions and never have blind allegiance to one doctor. We all make mistakes and are not perfect for we are truly
column23: only human - it is our nature. Anyone desiring to discuss what any medications have done for me were always welcome but you cannot base your results on someone else. You can only use it as a loose guideline for your own personal situation and physical makeup. That is where your trusted physician comes in and although they may be right on the money regarding one drug that works for you beware - they do not always remember all the drugs you are taking so that is where the patient must be vigilant
column24: especially when being referred from specialist to another doctor or specialist. I bring an up-to-date prescription printout to any new doctors as a new patient. Thank You -"

column2: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $5$4$5$"This medication has helped my ADD tremendously especially in the work place. Some side effects though more so from coming off of it when I take drug holidays they are usually spent sleeping on the couch. When I take it though I do very well and usually by the end of the day sleeping is not a problem. However it used to be a problem when I took the XR version. Now I take the plain old fashion immediate release tablets 30mg at a time. Once in the morning and then in the afternoon or I break my afternoon in half to make an additional 15mg available to take closer to 4:00pm but no later that a way I can stretch it out if its a longer day. At this dosage/prescription I don't suffer from insomnia as the drug tends to wear off my quickly at the end of the day and then I can sleep. Some side effects like feeling speedy and shaky can happen but are usually mild if not somewhat pleasant anyhow. I've been taking this dosage for years and I still say there is an advantage to having ADD. One is being able to take Adderall as I can usually run circles around my co-workers. When I'm on my medicine its like my personality lights up a little more and I stay focused and on task with little negative side effects. After so many years my body is addicted to it though hence the major withdrawal I go through on the couch on drug holidays. But if you don't mind being lazy and sleepy during those time I think it is well worth it all. Adderall is 4 amphetamine salts in one tablet so its like the inventors of this drug just said to themselves ""well one of these stimulants has to hit the right spot"" and then they marketed it with the clever name ADD ERALL. So for what ever reason it does work well for ADD. The only other drug I haven't tried for ADD is Desoxyn (methamphetamine) I guess I have been afraid to even ask for it just by the stigma that goes along with the name. So my experience with these drugs is well worth mentioning if you want an honest and thorough review.   "

column1: 1353$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$7/4/2011 8:13:02 PM$Reviewer: Nick
column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $4$4$4$"I am on Adderal XR. I began with 20 mgs and that worked for about three months. During this time I did not suffer from any side effects.But
column3: I began to feel ""out of it"" again and found myself struggling to focus and being overwhelmed with all my tasks. I also (again) had problems with impulsiveness and not being able to ""think clearly"". I asked my doctor for an increase and he then prescribed 30 mgs a day. It did help. I also discovered that the generic did not work for me. I am experiencing dry mouth as a side effect. With the medication I've estimated that it has decreased my impulsivity by 85%. I believe it has taken a years time and a bit more for me to see the maximum effect of the medication. It's as though my brain needed that much time to get ""soaked"" by the Adderall XR. I am now in the place where I am now starting to deal with developing good habits to overcome my great disorganization. I am trying to strengthen my ability to think linearly.  When I first started the medication (at 20 mgs and again at 30 mgs) I found disorganization unsettling and I became neater for a time.  I then again became sloppy and I was bothered by the fact that the sloppiness didn't seem to bother me. Over all I'm happy with the medication."

column1: 1356$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$7/1/2011 3:14:00 PM$Reviewer: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $4$3$3$"Overall
column2: Adderall (30mg/daily) has worked well for me. My academics have greatly improved and my ability to start
column3: continue
column4: and complete a task are a complete change. However
column5: like many others have said
column6: you quickly grow a tolerance to it. I have noticed an improvement with this by taking 1-2 days off a week. Those days are of course a little rough but the only thing that has helped me from the tolerance issues. I also have sleep apnea and if I'm having a rough day it sometimes makes me feel even more fatigued. The ""crashing"" after the medication begins to fade is sometimes worse then simply not taking it at all. So far the only medication I've tried for ADHD but overall a good medication thus far
column7: not sure If I'd say the same if used for sleep related disorders.

column1: 1358$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$6/23/2011 2:30:05 AM$Reviewer: wowthisstuffworks!, 19-24 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $5$5$5$I'm a college student majoring in electrical engineering and I was diagnosed with adhd when I was 12 years old: i was one angry and hyper kid! Anyways I was perscribed to Strattera as I entered middle school beginning with 20 mg. After seven years this medication was working miracles with a few ups and downs here and there... well that's the good part.
The bad news is the positive effects literally ""shut off"" in a matter of two weeks this past winter. I was back to that child who could barely read a couple of pages in a book
column2: let alone prepare for exams and papers as a college freshman. It was terrible: I lost great relationships with friends and family
column3: suffered from depression and constant unpredictable mood swings
column4: and the list goes on and on. Even with an increase in 80 mg the pills were useless unless two or more were consumed a day.

column1: I talked to my doctor about the problem and he said drastic neurochemical changes may have built a tolerance against the strattera
column2: which is farely common with that particular drug. To compensate
column3: he perscribed 20 mg of Adderall to take with 100 mg of Strattera a day
column4: and let me tell you
column5: the waters have settled and the sun shines again! Complete clarity and focus
column6: anxiety almost nonexistent
column7: and I feel back to my normal self. Only thing is that my appetite has diminished quite a bit and I have the libido of a neutered camel
column8: but those don't outweigh the fact that life is GREAT again. I could see where an addiction could transpire because it's pretty much altered cocaine that's approved by the fda
column9: but really it all comes down to you: ""can I survive w/o downing 16 pills today?"""

column2: 13-18 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $3$1$3$I was about 12 years old or so when I started taking Adderall. People said they noticed an immediate difference- my grades improved
column3: I started paying attention
column4: I was more obedient. Then
column5: by the time I turned 13
column6: I began to have chronic stomach pains
column7: which continue to plague me to this day. At the time
column8: I was battling ADD
column9: depression
column10: anxiety... you name it. The stomach issues were just another thing to add to the list. By age 15
column11: I had an endoscopy
column12: and it discovered I had a condition known as Eosinaphililic Esophagitis (I think that's how it's spelled) as well as an ulcer. I continued taking medicine to treat everything
column13: until I had the idea to just stop taking my medicine altogether. That was at age 16. For more than a year and a half

column15: my depression faded
column16: and I was still able to focus as well as I was able to on the drug. I haven't taken it since

column20: so technically

column22: I find it far from that. During the time I was taking the medicine

column24: it's been almost 2 years since I've taken them
column25: and the weight melted off naturally
column26: I'm down to 175- lighter than I've been in years. I feel better
column27: and I still can focus as well as I could on the drug
column28: despite not taking it. All in all

column1: 1403$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$4/22/2011 11:44:05 PM$Reviewer: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $4$1$3$"Whether or not you have ""ADD"" adderall will help you concentrate
column2: get things done
column3: be more efficient etc.. Im a Senior in college.. 95% of people use it to study. If your kid says this isn't true.. they are lying.. or a freshman.. or from Idaho. I was tested and given 20mg pills... at first it was amazing. Not only could I sit down studying for my exams for 10 hours straight (literally) but it felt fun to study. Class was all of a sudden so interesting. Loooong story short
column4: after a few months of using it off an on (about 3 pills a week) the effects changed. Yes
column5: I could concentrate better when I was alone studying/doing school work. However
column6: when taking adderall I felt like some kind of zombie. Like.. I couldn't smile couldn't laugh
column7: didn't want to talk to anyone..(Im usually very extroverted). The day after taking adderall I sleep until about 2 or 3 pm. Ew! Typically I wake up at 7am and cannot sleep past 9 am! Once you start using the drug it is hard to get off it. Example: I am not physically dependent but when HUGE exams come along I mentally feel like I NEEED adderall. And yes
column8: I use it. (Stopping after graduation in a week). The mind is a powerful thing. Once you get off the drug
column9: once simple tasks may seem laborious. Final point:: I wish I never tried it. Also... I agree with a comment right below.. it is so sad that children are given this drug. Crazy. Try changing their diet.. brain teasers.. holistic options! Im a psychology major and we were just learning how on a basic-level naturalists perspective.. kids are not supposed to have great concentration because its a time to explore as much as they can as their highly plastic brains develop. Soak it all in! Helloooo people
column10: what elementary kid do you see sitting still & silent focusing on their workbook 24/7? Little adderrall robot antisocial children? Oh yea.. in all of my neuroscience courses we learned the chemical properties of the drug. Very similar to speed.. and cocaine. "

column1: 1412$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$4/14/2011 10:37:24 AM$Reviewer: dave75b
column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $4$3$4$"I am 35 years old and have been taking Adderal for 6 months now. Although it has helped me focus on tasks and allowed me to complete projects without a problem it has also made me almost obsessed with whatever the task is that I am doing. For example
column3: I wanted to clean my pantry counter
column4: a quick spray with some cleaner and wipe it down
column5: no big deal right. About three hours later I realized I had cleaned the counter
column6: the stove inside and out
column7: the dishwasher
column8: sink
column9: floor
column10: and organized the cabinets. It felt as if I had to keep cleaning until everything was perfect and it just feels strange. Some may say that is a good thing but If I had video taped it I probably would of looked like a crazy person while doing it. Also
column11: I lost a good amount of weight since taking Adderal and now I feel I am to thin. I am 5'7"" and my weight was 155lbs before the Adderal
column12: I looked healthy. My weight went down to 132lbs and I looked sick but did manage over the last few months to get up to 145lbs. I take 50mg a day
column13: 30mg in the am and 20mg around noon. I have tried lowering the dose but it did absolutly nothing for me and without the second dose I end up crashing and want to nap by 2pm so the seond dose is basically to keep me going till bedtime. I do have trouble sleeping and even more trouble waking up but once I take my morning pill a half hour later I am good to go. Well that is my experience with Adderal so far
column14: oh yeah
column15: one more thing to add. I don't know if this happens to anyone else but I notice my hands and feet feel real cold at times and even though I will be sweating I am always cold. Well take care everyone
column16: hope everyone has a great day. :) "

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $4$4$4$I take 10mg twice daily
column3: once in the morning ~8-9am
column4: and again between 12 and 1pm. Have been doing so for about 6-7 yrs. Only other ADD med I've tried was Ritalin for a short time
column5: which didn't seem as helpful.  Pros: Improved focus
column6: concentration
column7: motivation for boring/difficult tasks.  Cons: Insomnia
column8: which is why I could not tolerate the extended release
column9: and must make sure not to take the 2nd dose later than about 1pm. A small dose of Trazadone (25-50mg) has helped with the insomnia. Does take away appetite temporarily
column10: but I make sure to force myself to eat adequately
column11: b/c if not I am left feeling ravenous at the end of the day when it is wearing off
column12: and have a headache and feel more moody than usual.  Need to take a 'drug holiday' at least 1 day each week
column13: or else the med starts to feel less effective.  I do tend to 'hyperfocus' on things that I shouldn't necessarily be focusing on at that given time
column14: but I'm not sure if this is just a symptom of ADD itself or a symptom exacerbated by the medication. Do see this as being addictive in terms of feeling the need to stay on it (though why would I NOT feel like I should stay on it
column15: as it is helpful for my ADD).  However have not ever felt the need for a higher dose.  May increase levels of anxiety
column16: if this is an underlying problem you already have. Has been helpful for ADD symptoms
column17: but I've also realized it is not a magic cure
column18: and cannot stress enough the importance of being proactive in terms of learning your individual weaknesses and trying different ways to help overcome them.  WebMD has been helpful
column19: along with www.ADDitude.com and www.ThriveWithADD.com.  Would love to meet with a psychotherapist that specializes in ADD
column20: but haven't been able to find such a thing.  A life coach specializing in ADD would also be great
column21: but unfortunately is not covered by insurance and seems to be quite costly.  Overall has been helpful for me
column22: but do believe that everyone is affected differently.  Good luck!

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $4$3$5$I am 40 yrs. old and have been on Adderall 20 mg 2x a day for 2 yrs. now. I am also on a BP med and Effexor XR.  All taken together have proven just how productive I am at completing tasks at work.  Although I have found that there is an interaction when I take the Adderall and Effexor together
column3: so now I allow at least 2 hrs. after taking Adderall before taking Effexor. The great thing is I have always been able to sleep really well.  After trial and error with other ADD meds found this to be most effective.  However at 3:30-4:00 pm in the afternoon it wears off.  I don't reallty know what to do with myself
column4: feel like I need a small dose to keep up with things I have to attend after work
column5: errands
column6: and in social settings. I am lucky to have a doctor who shares a real concern about the side effects in it increasing my heart rate.  She has already referred me to a cardiologist only to find that Adderall in combination with the other 2 meds raises my heart rate some.  Enough for her to put me on BP med taken everyday.  Sure there are some mild side effects of being tired but but there could be dangers in increasing the size of my heart down the road.  So the risks outweigh the mild side effects.  Just now need to bring to Dr's attention that I might need something for focus early evening.  Anybody out there who needs to take a small dosage of Adderall? Any suggestions?

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $5$1$4$"I took this drug from 2001 through 2010 and unfortunately never realized that this drug was the cause of intense calf pain and horrible circulation in my legs and hands. My feet used to literally turn blue. My legs in general were always bluish. I went to dozens of doctors over the past decade for a diagnosis. I even proactively asked the doctors if adderral could be causing the awful calf pain (which was the result of such poor circulation). The doctors all told me ""no"". FINALLY
column3: I found an incredible doctor who researched my pain extensively and told me that adderral may indeed be the cause of the freezing cold hands and feet
column4: as well as awful pain in my legs. Adderral is AWFUL to get off of. VERY DIFFICULT. I'm now off adderral and my pain is 90% better and I no longer have blue hands and feet. This drug can work wonders...but it has the potential to cause many health problems. "

column1: 1443$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$3/7/2011 11:15:08 PM$Reviewer: Lionheart
column2: 19-24 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $5$4$4$"This medication has its pros and cons. I've never been able to focus on anything for more than 30 minutes at most
column3: especially with work and school. It took a while to figure out what worked for me
column4: but due to insomnia I use the instant release tablets since they wear off by the end of the day. I take 15 to 30 mg per day and it works wonderfully. I feel like I can actually function like ""normal"" people. The downside is that this is a stimulant so it will wake you up and makes sleeping difficult. It also causes a loss of appetite
column5: which can be rather difficult to deal with. After taking a dose
column6: it becomes nearly impossible to eat. Even forcing food down with liquids is a chore. It's as if food has no appeal or satisfying taste. Another negative side-effect of the instant release tablets is the comedown. Since this is a stimulant similar to speed/cocaine/meth
column7: it can have an intense comedown. I become very easily agitated (little things will set me off)
column8: I get headaches
column9: and I overall just feel sick. This is more intense if you haven't been eating throughout the day and if your taking a higher dose. Being aware of how crappy the comedown is makes it easier to deal with. I now can control my mood very well during my comedown and it now rarely affects me. I am not recommending this since it is an illegal solution (unless you have a medical prescription)
column10: but ""herbal"" use has been extremely helpful with the side-effects. Once my day is over and my comedown is beginning to make me feel sick
column11: a little greenery goes a long way. It removes all the negative moods and headaches
column12: restores my appetite
column13: and helps me fall asleep. I can not believe such a helpful drug is illegal
column14: because I would be (more) underweight and sick without it. It's what works for me and my prescribing psychiatrist is aware of my use
column15: but I'm not here to preach about it.

column1: Basically
column2: Adderall side-effects can be ROUGH
column3: but without it I could never manage to work 8 hour days or sit through night class."

column1: Two weeks afterward

column1: Being as it's a stimulant

column3: most of which killed off my libido and led to sexual dysfunction.  My libido went sky high
column4: but it destroyed my ability to perform.  I'm sure it was caused by the Adderall in addition to smoking because I checked my blood pressure about a month later and it spiked to 165/80.

column1: I also have seasonal depression
column2: and during this period the Adderall made me irritable.  Eventually
column3: the depression killed off the effects of Adderall.  I just started an antidepressant
column4: so hopefully this will correct it.

column1: Be very careful if you have high blood pressure
column2: smoke
column3: or consume excessive amounts of caffeine.  If you anxiety
column4: depression
column5: or bipolar disorder
column6: as I do
column7: you may have better results with the Adderall in treating ADHD."

1457$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$2/16/2011 5:20:20 PM$Reviewer: Shyboi30
column2: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $2$2$1$I'm a 30 year old white male who is a recovering addict from meth. I'm diagnosed with ADD w\o Hyperactivity. My life has been a stuggle. I lived with this disorder untreated for most of my life. this is how I found my way to meth addiction before I found out my real problem.  I want everyone to know that this medication is nothing like meth. A lot of people say that it is and a lot of people believe that it is. Let me
column3: being someone who has experienced both. Tell you that it is not at all the same.  To be honest with you I wish that it was. Do not think that in anyway I'm trying to say that meth is a good drug in anyway. What I'm saying is
column4: is that meth for people with ADD is a form of self medication and its addicting to us because we become normal people. I had high hopes that this medication would have some of the positive results that meth offers and none of the negative attributes of that drug.  I'm pretty sure I can tell you why this medication is addictive to people though. I've been on a lot of different medications and have learned well how to evaluate their effect on my life. This medication is the most difficult to figure out dosage and the most inconsistent medication I have ever dealt with. This medication can be addicting for us because we are tired of living our lives with ADD. When you take the medication and get varied and inconsistent results you want positive results so you take more to try to find that place where it helps you and remains effective. Its not a medication that you can just take the dosage when your supposed to and it will do what its supposed to. So far I'm not pleased with adderall. I will probably ask my doctor for something else on my next visit and pray that something else will work better for me. I know that this medication helps some people and I really wish that I was getting those kind of results. It would be nice to be able to speak with other people taking this medication and see what their experience has been like.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$5$"This treatment is the best thing that has ever happened to me....I was diagnosed with ADHD when I was a little kid. At the time my mother refused to put me on medication because she feared I would be put into special ed classes. I hated school
column3: with a passion. I was bored with what I was being taught
column4: and focusing on doing homework was impossible. After dropping out of high school
column5: and moving to a different state
column6: I got my GED and started college. I talked to my doctor about my problems in the past with ADHD and she started me out on Concerta
column7: which didn't do anything at all. She then switched me to Adderall XR 20mg once a day. For me this medicine is an absolute miracle. I can't believe the difference it has made in my ability to focus
column8: not only on school
column9: but living life in general.

column1: This drug definitely does not work for everyone. I have read a lot of reviews about children having negative reactions. A close friend of mine's son was taking 30mg a day at the age of 12. He also has MANY other psychological problems as well
column2: and Adderall turned him into a monster. His rage towards everyone around him was unbelievable. When he stopped taking it his behavior improved tremendously. In my opinion I think doctors are giving kids way too high of a dosage.

column1: Withdrawals from Adderall is a nightmare. I've taken a few breaks from it for about a month at a time within the past few years. I slept at least 16+ hours a day for a week straight. When I wasn't sleeping I was eating. The mood swings were terrible
column2: and I had NO patience for ANYTHING or ANYONE. But after about a week I was almost back to normal.

column1: Adderall sometimes makes me very compulsive.  I will occasionally obsessively pick at my skin
column2: and once I start its really hard to stop. Not many people experience that. Also as a smoker
column3: it makes me smoke A LOT.

column1: I also found that Vitamin C pretty much blocks Adderall from absorbing into the body. Once I stopped drinking juices w/ vit. C
column2: the Adderall worked normall"

column2: 55-64 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $3$2$4$"I have PTSD from service in Vietnam. 100% disabled.  Recently in the last year I noticed radical changes in my behaviors and sypmtoms.  Not being able to focus
column3: concentrate

column5: with the PTSD I would not be able to go to sleep at night with racing thoughts about the war or I would go to sleep and wake up in sweating from horrible nightmares. Now it's like I have both going on except I seem to not have the racing thoughts about the war so much
column6: in fact
column7: hardly at all.  I recently started taking 20mg of Adderall XR last week but it does not last long enough and I only feel just a little bit more like doing tasks and finishing them.  It just doesn't feel like the dosage is strong enough.  I find myself drifting off to sleep in the middle of the afternoon.  I have a fulltime Psychologist and MD to monitor my situation.

column1: My Internest MD diagnosed me with ADD."

column2: 7-12 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Caregiver) $5$5$5$My son is 10yrs old in the 4th grade (held him back in 1st grade due to failing while he was getting diagnosed.) He started taking Adderall @ 10mg 1x per day in the AM
column3: 5 months ago. He is ADHD with all the hyperactivity and lack of ability to focus on any tasks
column4: no matter how minor they may be. He was diagnosed at age 6 in the first grade. We have tried at least 8 different medications in the last four years. As he grows
column5: the meds seem to sometime lose their effect after a certain period of time. Concerta was great for almost 2yrs and then we tried various others till we found Adderall. It worked GREAT! He stays focused and we do not have any side effects at all! Not even the loss of appetite which was always a problem with the other medications. I am very pleased with this medication
column6: and at times this may be frustrating as a parent to go through finding what works for your child. But once you find the medication that works for your child
column7: it definitely is worth everything to see your child succeed at all he does
column8: especially in school. My son is a very caring
column9: loving and happy child and have never had any problems as far as anger issues that many people might mention. He is just full of energy and cannot stay focused on one task
column10: school assignments or just doing things in order such as fix your bed and next clean out your back pack....he may start the bed but will soon be jumping in the living room having not completed his bed or much less totally forgot about his back pack...

column1: 1623$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$8/25/2010 6:25:54 AM$Reviewer: dukecitydude
column2: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $5$5$5$"Adderall is one of the very few true ""miracle drugs."" I was finally diagnosed with ADHD (primarily inattentive) at age 23. I've been prescribed the other meds
column3: but for the past 10 years I've been on the same dose of Adderall (20mg t.i.d.) and nothing works better. With Adderall I am able to focus
column4: think before acting
column5: I'm much less anxious and my temper is curbed. All of which give me much more confidence in the things I do. Hell
column6: it even helps me sleep better!

column1: Prior to diagnosis w/ADHD
column2: I had a brief stint of drug use (and I know that's a contraindication)
column3: but in all honesty
column4: Adderall was of great help in stopping those behaviours. It's amazing what can happen when a person gains cognitive clarity & patience to assist in positive decision-making.

column1: Although it can increase anxiety in some and if you have cardiovascular issues - forget it
column2: I highly recommend at least a trial of this medication if you have ADD/ADHD. It continues to do wonders for me. :)"

column3: loss of appetite
column4: headaches
column5: upset stomach
column6: mood swings. Side effects from 20MG XR tabs: Extreme weight loss (24 lbs.) over a 2 month period

column1: 1635$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$8/7/2010 4:16:09 PM$Reviewer: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $5$4$5$I was first prescribed Adderall XR when I was 16 years old. Every doctor I have asked assures me that there are no proven negative long term effects of taking this medication for a long period of time.  But I can help but think otherwise. It is an amphetamine after all. Other issues I am concerned about have been the effect it has on me when I stop taking it completely. I am very tired and don't really know what to expect or I'm aware of things that are going on around me but can't really grasp the concepts. I have tried the none Extended Release Adderall and it was very unsatisfactory! BLEH! I would take one in the morning and then one in the afternoon and I had major side effects
column2: tremors
column3: ticks
column4: I kept clenching my jaw and I was very unhappy. I am satisfied with the results and ease of the XR tablets. column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $5$5$5$"Okay so anything that actually works can be called addictive because you actually need it to accomplish things the normal person is already getting done...I don't sleep till 1pm anymore and yes the house is clean and things are becoming more and more organized.

column1: As far as moods go (I know its not FDA approved) I take Damiana by Nature's Answer and there Black Cohosh with no adverse reactions or side effects along with my Adderall
column2: multivitamins and fish oil and yes my husband is very happy as well.Set aside some time for the kids even if you have to take a break from the cleaning... And forget the Xanax because that will just reduce the Adderall you are taking.Try to get the doctor to give you divided doses of the Adderall instead of one large dose-it costs more but much more effective and remember when it comes to Adderall dosages sometimes less is more... Effective....10mg BID or 15mg BID both are better then 20mg or 30mg a day.Also be sure to take them at 8am and 12pm-4 hours apart...You should be sleeping fine by night time -Ambien should never be needed and if it is your dosage needs to be decreased..."

1793$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$2/17/2010 1:54:14 PM$Reviewer: 7-12 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver) $5$5$5$My son is in 4th grade & had extreme difficulties at school such as focus,comprehension,accumulating info, disorganized,not being able to finish the work in class, math, etc. He was also diagnosed a couple of years ago with DAMP. He was on Ritalin for a couple of months 2 yrs ago & stopped since we did not see any improvement. we were at the point of desperation & had enough frustrations & so did he!Therefore eventhough I was very much against drugs we decided that he needs help so let's give it another try! His dr. prescribed Adderall 10mg/day in the AM before breakfast- a miracle has been brought upon my son & our family!! it works wonderful, amazing! the only side affects that I noticed are the loss of appetite (which I am not too upset over since he is about 6 lbs. overweight & noticed that he is hungry in AM, so I give him a healthy breakfast) and sensitivity (he easily cries if someone gets him upset).Other than that there have been no other side affects. we are all extremely happy to see him do extremely well at school. He was never hyper, but had some behavior problems - even that has changed for the better.  He interacts & socialized better w/friends. Prior to this med his grades were Cs and Ds; ever since he started on Adderall the test results are amazing; A's in social studies and B+ in math!!  Not only that it makes everyone happy (his family as well as teachers)that he's doing so well but he is very well aware of it & I can see the happiness that he did not have before when he comes home with good grades & ease at learning!! He has built confidence & holds his head up high!! Thank you Dr. Weidner!!!...& of course Adderall!  I shall return & review this med in a couple of month & let everyone know if he's still doing just as well and/or if the side affects have changed!
1794$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$2/13/2010 11:11:15 PM$Reviewer: a3gill, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $5$5$5$Adderall has been a lifesaver. I took Ritalin as a kid and developed some nervous ticks. So
column2: I dropped it
column3: and tried to manage without. I did fine until college reading emerged.

column1: I have a ridiculously high dosage
column2: but it works great for me
column3: other than nasty looks that I get from Pharmacists thinking that I am a dealer.(that buys inventory with insurance...LOL) My dosage is steady now
column4: but for about the first year
column5: it was increased each month. That’s probably just me though
column6: my body doesn’t respond well to medicine.

column1: Reading comprehension has always been my biggest hurdle
column2: non-technical reading is virtually impossible for me. Just below reading is hanging-in with poor lecturers. I need to have genuine interest in something or my mind will promptly begin to wander. If a teacher shows the end goal and it appears interesting
column3: then the uninteresting stepping stones become interesting
column4: because they are required to get to the concept that you want to know. Conversely
column5: if a teacher presents each building block as something to know
column6: ""because I said so
column7: then I will be staring out the window before they finish their sentence.

column1: Since arriving at the correct dosage
column2: I can now do anything that I want. Not only are my problem areas fixed
column3: but other aspects have improved as well. The best way that I can describe it is having a librarian roaming around in your brain. My capacity for learning has gone off the charts
column4: my memory retention and recollection is ridiculous
column5: and the boost of energy really shines though in self-motivation. And
column6: above all
column7: I now spend at least 2-4 hours per day reading anything that I want.

column1: To put my improvement in context
column2: I took my ACT’s un-medicated. My best score was a 29/36.

column1: Hmm
column2: it’s okay
column3: but look at the pieces:

column1: Math: 36/36
Science Reasoning: 35/36
English: 32/36
Reading: 14/36
I noticed the benefits most
column2: when I lost them with my insurance for a month. Not withdraw symptoms
column3: having to deal with my old flawed brain. I was spoiled.

column1: 1859$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$11/7/2009 6:31:11 PM$Reviewer: NikiM1973
column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$5$Since taking Adderall I consistently do the right things at the right time. Before Adderall I struggled with moments of genius followed by days of a mixture of procrastination and chaos. With Adderall my focusing abilities are quite amazing. I have to actually be careful to not over-focus. I can honestly get so hooked on the details of a particular work project that I find myself working for 12+ hours without much of a break. So with that said I should probably urge everyone to try to maintain a life of balance. I've always been good at what I do
column3: but now I can do more with less. I eat less. I sleep less. I waste time less. I make mistakes less. I'm more patient. I'm overall much happier. Am I addicted to it? Yes. When I don't take it I'm an even bigger disaster than before. If I don't take it I could stay in bed all day and stare at the TV. For me
column4: the Adderall PROS outweight the CONS. If you are a distracted mess with piles of papers
column5: a racing mind
column6: and an inability to put first things first then I suggest you talk with your doctor about trying a low dose for starters. I've been taking Adderall for about 4 years and I take 40 mg daily
column7: in the form of two (2) 20mg tablets. I do not like the XR (extended release) formulation of any medication
column8: so it is not specific to Adderall.

column1: 1887$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$10/1/2009 9:31:07 AM$Reviewer: 35-44 Female  (Patient) $4$2$3$I am 38 yr old mother of two. My experience is the time release(XR) is the best form the non time release feels like you are on a roller coaster.  The time release is very smooth.  Although I started on 20mg I believe after 5 years on this and now down to 5mg a day this is a very hard drug on my body as a women.  I have two best friends on it and although we love the weight it keeps off and how organized we think we are on it we all believe there is a dark side to this drug that no one talks about. Everyone seems OK in our lives except our husbands.  There is an edgy/anger piece that goes along with this drug..  I think it effects our hormones in some way.  My suggestion is start on a lower dose and move up but I am looking for more natural choices because I think this drug makes life go by very quickly.  I also think as a women you can not help but get addicted to the way you burn more calories and it automaticly suppresses your appetite.  If you are on this and are having relationship problems then you might want to look at this drug as a reason and not other outside things. Also I think if you take the wrong dose it can actually make it harder to complete some things. This drug is in the same family as Meth amphedemines.  If you take this drug you should really think about the similarities to being a junkie!! I stopped taking it for 6 months and gained 30 pounds and I started sleeping a lot and my house became a disaster.  There is probably something better out there
column2: but I have not found it.

column1: 1888$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$9/30/2009 11:13:17 PM$Reviewer: 3-6 on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver) $2$2$2$

column2: it really does. Unfortunately
column3: I became HIGHLY ADDICTED to this medication. I am 21 and a university student and have been on adderall since i was 19. In just two years i developed a 100mg+ habit per day
column4: ended up literally going crazy
column5: cutting
column6: attempting suicide
column7: committed to a psychiatric hospital
column8: and then drug and alcohol rehab. Since I kicked adderall
column9: I have been just fine. Kids won't tell you anything is wrong
column10: because it makes them feel so good they want it more. It severely disrupts eating habits (I lost 35lbs
column11: and as a 5'2"" female
column12: that's a lot)
column13: sleeping habits
column14: and overall mood. I also found a sharp decline in imagination and overall creativity. Irritability
column15: dehydration
column16: diarrhea
column17: malnutrition
column18: anemia
column19: and withdrawals were part of my adderall use that was prescribed by a psychiatrist for ADHD.

column1: PLEASE
column2: if you are a parent wondering if your kid should be on adderall (which is an amphetamine salt
column3: which is the single purest form of SPEED)
column4: think again. Is it worth it in the long run? It is SPEED that you're messing with here- incredibly serious drug. There are many many more behavioral modifications that can be taught that are much more effective
column5: and MUCH MUCH less detrimental to overall mental and physical health.

column1: 1893$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$9/25/2009 6:58:45 PM$Reviewer: Leland

column1: 1896$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$9/18/2009 12:05:06 PM$Reviewer: GEElo
column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $4$4$3$Taking Adderall XR with suboxone makes a pill cocktail. The high from those two drugs combined is a whole new ball game. First of all Docs know nothing but to see you on your appointment and then get rid of you. If they payed any attention they would know that a person with a history of drug or alcohol abuse should not take adderall or adderall xr. But then again they keep us coming back for business. So
column3: would that make them a legal drug dealer. Yes
column4: it would. I had a chemical dependency to perscription painkillers. I realized something was really bad when I was taking them just to be able to function from day to day. I sought help because things were all jacked up. If I could make a difference in someone's life just by writing this little piece then all the pain I caused myself and everyone around me
column5: then I would have to say it was worth it. If you have a chemical dependency the first thing you do is decide weather or not you want to continue that way of life
column6: which is extremely painful. Second
column7: commit to yourself in getting well. You will need a really good support system to help you through it. With hard work and dedication to yourself you will succeed. If you follow those three rules you will get through it with out a dought. If I had to go through it again I would have gone to the psychiatrist to get on suboxone so I could wing myself through it. I was on suboxone for one year exactly. If I would have just listened to my brother and not got on the suboxone I would have gotten over the emotional withdrawl after about 5 to 7 days. The physical withdrawls(tiredness
column8: unmotivated)would eventually pass around three to four weeks. So
column9: you could get through it in a months time verses getting on suboxone and wasting a year of your life.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $4$4$4$I've struggled with ADD my entire life but my parents were totally against medicating me (thank you mom and dad) Instead they made an effort to get me help from tutors and personal coaches that taught me good organizational and study habits which helped a bit. I struggled all through out my 6 years of college and now at 26
column3: moving into the ranks of working for myself and taking on several projects
column4: I could really use some help. My buddy gave me some adderall and I probably got more work done in 2 weeks than my 6 years of college- mainly because I neither ate nor slept for days at time. I also found that I was able to pop these like skittles with frightening ease. I couldn't see taking this medication daily as I wouldn't risk my physical and psychological well-being for any amount of work or money. I believe this should be used as a last resort. One thing I have learned is to observe my work habits while on adderall vs. when I'm not and try to mimic those behaviors daily. This drug is certainly a tool for success but I feel that it shouldn't be used as a way of living.

column1: 1904$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$9/9/2009 3:20:42 PM$Reviewer: absent_minded
column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $4$4$5$"I was started out on 20mg of Adderall Oral daily (in the morning). But currently
column3: my dosage has been increased to 30 mg each morning
column4: with the option to take another 10 to 20 mg later on in the day during long work days. I have an ADHD sufferer's worst nightmare for a job: I'm mostly a paper-pusher/interviewer. I'm a social worker for a corrections department. I have piles of paperwork everyday. I also teach decision-making and social skills classes
column5: which also require a lot of planning and organization. I had been able to negotiate with and compensate for my ADHD all through grade schools
column6: high school
column7: and college. However
column8: my condition became dibillitating at my first ""career"" job with the massive amounts of paperwork and organization I was expected to perform. I'm in my early 20s and began treatment for ADHD at the beginning of August. I feel that the medication has helped me immensely. My family
column9: fiance
column10: and coworkers have all noticed the change in my work habits and all-around behavior. I'm quieter
column11: more focused
column12: and less apt to ""fly off the handle"" for minor things that don't seem to make much sense to anyone else. I'm pretty satisfied overall with my results. That said
column13: I do experience some side effects. I have had pretty significant loss of appetite as well as weight loss. But for me
column14: its not a major issue at the moment as I was already considered somewhat overweight by my doctor when I started the medication. If I continue to lose at this rate
column15: I suppose it could become a problem. I also experience dry mouth pretty badly. I sometimes get it so bad that my whole mouth feels ""fuzzy."" But luckily
column16: I'm allowed to keep a drink on my desk at work :) Also
column17: I occasionally experience headaches that I believe are related to the medication. But these aren't very often. All in all
column18: there's some drawbacks/side effects
column19: but the benefits far outweight them."

column2: 7-12 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $5$4$5$Adderall has helped me focus so much better and I have went to C's and D's to A's and B's in my grades.  My teachers have actually came up to me and asked if I  was the same person who was in their clas a week ago.  It has helped me get through fourth through sixth grade.  The only problem I have is that it made me want to do evreything at once and that really stressed me out.  I got mild depression becuase of that and I'm now taking an antidepressant AND Adderall.  It's kind of hard to remember to take both the drugs and I somtimes miss a few day on one or both of the drugs.  This drug worked on me but please find out exactly what it does to you before making a comitment to taking it.  Ask your doctor if you can start on the lowest dosage possible and graduly work your way up untill you find a dosage right for you.  Like any other medication it is a hit or miss and you should stop taking it if it worsens your condition or if you have side effects lasting longer than two weeks.  I hope my information helped!

column1: 1921$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$8/4/2009 1:09:43 PM$Reviewer: TheDoc
column2: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Caregiver) $5$5$5$"As a Doctor myself
column3: I have to stress that when it comes to Adderall in either the XR or IR forms
column4: there is no grey area. There are those patients who do extremely well on this medication and others who were perhaps misdiagnosed or physiologically intolerant of the chemical makeup of the drug. The bottom line is: If you need it
column5: it can work wonders. However
column6: if you're one of those who doesn't truly suffer from ADD ADHD-Hyp
column7: then you may gain some benefits
column8: but you will also have more incidence of negative side-effects. My personal experience with the IR has been wonderful. Most everyone has the associated loss of appetite
column9: and general ""fidgety"" feeling when starting treatment
column10: but these do subside. However
column11: they have a nasty habit of resurfacing later on in treatment. This usually accompanies an increase in dosage
column12: but can pop up for seemingly no reason at all. The best advice I can give regarding treatment with amphet salts is: If you need it
column13: then it can help tremendously. However
column14: if you don't need it
column15: you're better off with those awful energy drinks or a few cups of coffee. Hope this helps."

column6: and would lie about anything.  It was like a alien had taken over my son's body.  It has been a nightmare and I would never encourage any parent to give this drug to their children. column7: vomiting
column8: headaches etc.  My hope for his once bright future now rests on his ability to overcome an apparent addiction and not to be drawn back down that road. column9: enthusiatic young man back.

1937$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$7/17/2009 7:37:52 PM$Reviewer: 19-24 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $4$4$4$I am a college student and have been started taking Adderall because I have been on a downward slope academically since my freshman year of high school to now. Although I have had problems with paying attention, getting started with projects, etc., I was able to get by. The work in school, naturally, has become harder. I have been a B/C student for awhile now. For the last month, I have yet receive any assignment that is less than an A. Menatlly, this drug has helped. Physically, not so much. I have noticed that I am more hyperactive. I am constantly fidgeting with my hands and my legs are shake profusely. Also, my eating habits are terrible. I was at a slim 135 pounds to begin with before I began the medication and I know for a fact that I will have lost weight the next time I see my doctor. One side effect is loss of appetite. This effect is extremly noticeable. For me, I very very rarely feel hungry. Just last week I forgot to eat ANYTHING for two straight days. Overall though, if you are careful and responsible this is an effective and easy-to-use drug. Hopefully, this helps.

1953$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$6/23/2009 5:16:35 PM$Reviewer: Jess, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $4$4$5$I've been diagnosed with ADHD since age 6, I am now 26 years old.  I'm overall satisfied with this medication.  I noticed that my mood seems to be more even, I have a better handle on my disorder versus the other medications I've taken, and most of my other symptoms are under control.  I have noticed weight loss but my doctor told me before hand that it would happen. Being that I gained some weight after I stopped my previous medication, I didn't mind that too much.  I have also noticed more dry-mouth than my other medications so I'm drinking a lot more water through the day, but I don't mind that so much as I drink a good amount of water anyway.  One thing that I will have to say is that I keep having to 'readjust.'  My doctor, who I love, started me on an extreme low dose and is working me up to my 'stable' point which has spanned over 8 months now.  Getting to the point of 'stable' is my biggest issue since precautions have to be taken. Due to the nature of this drug, that the risk of addiction is high, my doctor and I are taking it slow.
1954$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$6/23/2009 4:11:16 PM$Reviewer: 19-24 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $5$5$5$I have been taking adderall 20mg once a day and this drug is very affective in treating my ADHD.  I explained that I have a very hard time concentrating.  Whether face to face conversations, reading, or in meetings it was very difficult to give my undivided attention to someone or a group. Additionally, I have struggled for a long time in school, college especially and thought it was just lack of sleep. However, both of my brothers have ADHD and after talking to my doctor about my condition he recommended adderall 20mg.  I was jittery at first (simular to too much caffine) but now Im getting used to it.  I now do not crash everyday after work and no longer need my afternoon nap.  I also can focus on conversations and remeber things much better.  It enables me to be more productive and I can get much more stuff done than before.  It does curve my appetite too so make sure if you take this med. to eat as you did before.

1961$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$6/17/2009 12:08:11 PM$Reviewer: 13-18 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$3$5$i am a 16 year old. I started taking adderall at the age of twelve. When i was on the drug it was very effective. It helped me concentrate in school, calmed me down from acting out, and helped prevent me from doing bad things. Although it has done good, it has also done bad. For example, i started losing weight because i never had an appetite, i became more distant with people because i was quiet all the time from focusing on things, and i also became needy of it all the time. I have been off of the pills for about a year now and I'm doing just fine. It is extremely hard to get out of the habit of needing them. It takes time to get out of the habit, but eventually it will work. Trust me.  Adderall can be very addictive and although it can benefit you, it may also destroy you in some ways. So one tip to take into consideration if you want to start taking adderall is to start off at a low dosage and work your way up until you feel it is doing its job.

You will become addicted to it after a while
