1966$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$6/8/2009 10:35:36 PM$Reviewer: $3$3$1$I am junior in high school and have been taking adderall for 3 years. At first it seemed like a miracle drug. My grades went up considerably and I felt that I had gained a sense of control. I was prescribed 30mg a day including one 20mg pill of adderall xr. The side effects were harsh in the beginning and I lost a lot of weight. The next 2 years I would take it regularly still having the same side effects but very mild. In short
column2: I could go off the pill and feel fine for any amount of time. But I began to feel a sort of dependence on the drug about a year after. The loss of appetite seemed to be a motivation for me to be thin so i started to up my dose a little bit. My grades went from a 3.3 to a 2.7 and so i figured I was immune to the drug so I started to take even more. For the past about 6 months I have regularly been taking at the least 50mg and at most 70mg a day. Sometimes I don't know why I am taking it I just do. I can honestly say in the past week I have slept in total maybe 10-15 hours some nights not sleeping at all. My heart is constantly pounding and my hands are always shaking. I hate it but i can't help it. My parents dont hide my pills or anything and dont keep track of when they get it so it makes it easy for me.I am always very moody and today I had a nutri grain bar and thats it but I dont even feel hungry. I didnt think drugs prescribed to myself could be so addictive but they are. I suggest people not to take them to begin with.

column2: 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $5$5$5$"I have been taking Adderall since last November (08).  I was started on 20mg of Adderall xr
column3: then went to 25 mg xr
column4: and now I take 25mg xr in the morning around 6am
column5: and then an Adderall IR
column6: 10mg
column7: around noon to one p.m.  I think Adderall works great
column8: the problem I had was that even though it is an XR formulation it seemed to wear off around noonish everyday.  I was never able to get ""all day coverage"".  In February my doctor added the 10mg IR ""booster"" and it has worked great ever since.  He told me that every one's body metabolism is different and some get longer coverage than others.  This is what worked for me.  I was worried about sleep issues being on this dose
column9: the amazing thing is I actually feel like I sleep better since being on this medication.  When I lay down to go to sleep I don't have a million and one things floating through my head like I use to.  It's like the background ""white noise"" is gone.  My thoughts are so much clearer now and I can actually get things accomplished instead of 20 things half accomplished.  It's too bad people abuse this drug
column10: it's makes it more difficult for people who use it for legitimate medical purposes to get it.  All of my other medications I can get a 90 day supply in the mail.  With Adderall I have to go to my doctors office every month and pick up my prescription in person.  Other than that absolutely no complaints.  Good luck to all.   "

column2: 45-54 Female  (Patient) $5$5$5$"I am a 49 yr female... I always knew I was differrent. I felt like information went into my brain but went right out the other side. I would read
column3: listen to a lecture or be in a conversation and end with no recollection of the information I was given. How was I to explain this to a doctor... I thought they would think I was crazy. I rehearsed over and over what I would say to them to make them believe there truely was a problem. How much easier it would be to go in and show them a cut
column4: bruise or broken bone... they could fix it. How could they diagnose or fix a problem they couldn't see and I couldn't explain. I spent 7 years in and out of the doctors office. She first put me on prozac
column5: treated me for an inter-ear infection
column6: had me get all of my old fillings replaced
column7: got glasses
column8: treated me for allergies
column9: etc. All these things were good but there was still something much more. She gave up
column10: one day she said ""I can't help you"". Talk about a heart break and a validation that I was crazy. One day I read an ad on Straterra... explaining the symptoms of adult ADHD. I asked my doctor if there were special test for that. She said yes
column11: as she rolled her eyes
column12: but she would have to refer me to a shrink...here we ago again!

column1: The psycologist had me diagnosed in moments. No special tests were needed. The Straterra has helped for about 6 years now but there was still something more that I couldn't put my finger on. I have been going to doctors now for another 3 years to finally get one to take my extreme fatigue seriously. I took a sleep test and I have mild narcolepsy. My doctor has recently added adderall and I am finally content that what I have been silently struggling with all my life has been discovered and properly treated. I breaks my heart to pieces to think I raised my 3 children without this help. I struggled so badly just to make it through each day and hide my feelings of ""stupidness"". Now at almost 50
column2: I feel like I have a clear mind...and a new start on life.   "

column2: 35-44 on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years$5$5$4$I am a successful nationally known professional advertising photographer who was on Adderall for about five years and then decided that I did not need it anymore because all of my old ADHD habits where mostly gone. I was off of them for about three months and all of those long gone adhd habits that had played havoc with my life started coming back one by one. Unpaid parking tickets
column3: loosing my keys
column4: rash decisions
column5: unfinished project after unfinished project. Within six months I had almost lost my photography business that I had worked so hard for and had collections agencies after me etc.  Wow what a bust to my ego! I guess I really do need to be on Adderall. It's as if when I am not on Adderall I know exactly what it is I need to do to keep my life running smooth...I put together my to do list but the to do list never gets completed. Yes I am a successful advertising photographer with lots of talent...but without the discipline and focus to apply that talent my world falls apart. I guess I just need to take it...it is what it is. I know there are lots of talented artists who take adderall...and I do not feel it makes me any less creative....or for that matter any more creative. How one little adderall XR pill makes the difference between being reasonably disciplined and totally irresponsible
column6: however
column7: is beyond me...but for me the reality is just that. I am now back on Adderall 20 MG XR and things are going great again. Hope this was helpful to any other artists out there who are struggling with the to medicate/not to medicate question. In my case the choice was made for me...I do not even think I would still be in business without this drug..no kidding.

2081$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$11/27/2008 10:18:49 AM$Reviewer: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $4$4$5$I have had ADHD, most likely since I was a young kid (I'm now 24), but diagnosed a little over 1 year ago.  I recently finished graduate school, and stopped the Adderall since I stopped seeing the MD.  Now that I've been back on it (about 2 weeks) I'm much more focused, I don't drift off when I'm speaking to clients and feel more motivated to finish my work on time.  I'm also  not binging as often as I used to, which is extremely helpful since I have gained 10 pounds in the last 6 months.  I don't feel aggressive or angry to the point where its affecting my life and hurting others.  Of course, I still have to make some behavioral changes to improve my organizational skills, but that's not something any medication can fix.  Don't expect it to change everything, as part of the treatment for ADHD is to learn new tools to combat the symptoms.  This medication is not a good idea if you or any family members have a history of substance abuse or dependence, since you are predisposed to those conditions.  If you have any psychiatric issues in addition to the ADHD, you must speak with your doctor about them, since treatment will be counterproductive.  You play the greatest role in your treatment-not the medication.

column2: 13-18 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $5$4$4$"I began taking adderall at 15mg when I was in the 4th grade (2001-2002) I lost about 28 pounds almost immediatly which was not a bad thing because I was about 30 pounds over weight. column1: Side effects I have experienced:
Lose of Weight
Lose of Apetite
Depression
O.C.D symptoms (extermely prevelent in my last two years)
Anxiety
Paranoia
P.T.S.D

It is strange I go through a living hell almost day by day which may or may not be because of the Adderall but I can not just stop taking it because I fear being the way I am when I'm off of it during my everyday life because I get really ""crazy"" when I am not on it and eat a lot and just am moody and its pretty bad so I stay on it even though sometimes (more than less) I feel like a am losing my mind. column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $5$5$5$"I am a 48 y.o university professor
column3: - after years of frustration and depression because of my procrastination habits and
column4: as I described it
column5: a lack of engagement between my brain and my body. I finally went into therapy just over a year ago at the urging of my wife and was diagnosed with ADHD. I started taking Adderall about 8 months ago. I have found that Adderall is very effective at helping me to focus and listen. It helps me to be more deliberate in my actions
column6: I'm not just drifting through the day. In my classroom I have found that I am able to listen to myself better and not be distracted by those students who give me that 'I'm so bored' look. One of the most interesting effects I've found is that I now actually hear and listen to the lyrics of songs! - never did that before. Looking back at my life
column7: all the way to when I was 6 years old I now recognize the symptoms that had always been there.  I feel that the treatment is working for me
column8: but as my doctor says
column9: the worst part is that I'm 48 and have only now finally taken care of a life-long problem. I take 30 mg. (15 mg standard 2 x a day). I did feel the side effects for about the first two or three days (teeth grinding and dry mouth) but they subsided and I don't have any issues with that now. I've lost a few pounds
column10: but I love to eat and  once I start eating
column11: my appetite is fine. I know that I'll have to continue with this
column12: probably for the rest of my life
column13: but I think of it as a simple compound that my body chemistry is simply missing - so it helps me a lot.

column1: Finally I would say to those of you suffering horrible side effects
column2: stop
column3: and get another opinion! If the side effects are that bad
column4: then you probably have a different problem. Amphetamines are an important drug that can work well for those who need it
column5: but if you don't
column6: you are abusing it. I thought that it would be like the speed we experimented with in high school
column7: but it's not. It is an essential part of my life now
column8: stigma or not -"

column1: 2118$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$9/27/2008 5:21:59 PM$Reviewer: DevinT
column2: 19-24 on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $4$3$4$"In high school
column3: my mom kept on me to do my schoolwork
column4: which was good.  However
column5: half way through college
column6: I started failing classes not having support
column7: so I went to the school counselor.

column1: She helped me out a bit with a schedule
column2: but still in crunch time
column3: halfway through a Term (quarter)
column4: I just couldn't focus for homework.  She brought up ADD
column5: so I contacted a Psychiatrist.

column1: My psychiatrist wasn't there
column2: so I had my initial assessment with a stand in.  She said I probably have Bipolar II (hypomanic-depressive).  Shocked
column3: I still geared up and looked up symptoms and this and that.  Sure
column4: so I have mild/moderate Bipolar...I thought everyone did.

column1: I had an appointment with my real psychiatrist
column2: and he was on the edge on if I was Bipolar or ADD.  Apparently
column3: a lot of the symptoms overlap.  It was possible I have both
column4: though
column5: so I scheduled another appointment and took Lamictal for BP2.

column1: The appointment after that was halfway through the term.  The mood swings were better
column2: but I still couldn't focus.  I was ""driven to distraction"" as he put it.  I would procrastinate to the point where I was not confident I could get the work done
column3: and then to cheer myself up
column4: I would do the very thing that I used to procrastinate (like a video game).

column1: He prescribed me this stuff
column2: Amphetamine Salts.  I took it the day after he prescribed it...and for good reason.  I had an assignment due the next morning.  I had a meeting to prepare for and run.  I had important people to email.

column1: It felt like I was sipping on a heavily caffeinated beverage all day.  That's when I'm most motivated.  I got all the emails sent out
column2: I ran the meeting just fine
column3: and I edited 8 pages of a document that I have been sitting on for over a year.

column1: The side effects I experienced were dry mouth
column2: muscle tension
column3: strange busts of tiredness that go away in 10 minutes
column4: high blood pressure (expected)
column5: feeling a little cold
column6: easy smiling
column7: and restlessness.

column1: It's been 3 days.  I actually WANT to do work now.  So weird..."

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $3$2$5$I am a mental health therapist

column4: and know in my heart that I am addicted
column5: and struggle with knowing this everyday.  With not wanting to refill my script
column6: but knowing that the addict in me will call my doctor and get a refill.  Knowing that I will become emotionless and cold
column7: sleepless and edgy
column8: but with a clean house and unhappy children who don't understand why their mom is so tense and angry.  I know that I will start having to take Zanax and Ambien to calm down at night
column9: and that the divide between my husband and I will grow bigger.  This medication helped me at first

column12: but my sister also has the exact same problems.  While I thought we would be having cookouts and taking our kids to the park
column13: instead we are swapping scripts and pills and cleaning tips.  I caution everyone who is thinking about taking this drug to consider whether they can do it responsibly
column14: and their family history of addiction.  Reading these other reviews makes me feel much less alone
column15: but also very sad that so many people are having these problems.  I realize that I may need help to get off of it
column16: but that is very hard when you work in the field that I do and your professional reputation is on the line.  I use up my script in less than two weeks
column17: and then have two weeks without it.  The two weeks w/out it are so much better
column18: but the addict in me never listens.  Every month I think I can do it responsibly.  I just wonder
column19: when is it gonna be to much?  I know the saying one is to many and a thousand is never enough.  In my case
column20: that is so true.  Please be careful.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $3$2$1$"I have been switching between Adderall XR and Adderall non-time released for about 3 years. Right now I take 90 milligrams a day of Adderall non-time released. I have days where I am tired
column3: on these days I take more than perscribed. In my opinion Adderall is highly ""abusive"". When you take a medication long enough your body becomes immune and the medication isnt as effective as it was when you first started taking it.

column1: I dont think Adderall should be prescribed to children under the age of 18. All it takes is a simple 20 question evaluation and you are prescribed a drug that may forever change your life.
I have tried to stop taking Adderall and I have not been successful yet. I get so mad at myself when I sleep for 5 days straight (when im finally back to normal) and then go back to the Adderall.
My advice to anyone condsidering this medication is to get a second opinion. Honestly
column2: I know I dont have ADHD or ADD
column3: the Adderall makes me have ADHD. I didnt need this medication when I was prescribed it 3 years ago and now I cant get away from it. I have faith in God that He will get me through this and allow me to feel again. The Will of God will never take you where the grace of God cannot protect you. God bless you all!!

column1:
2151$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$7/14/2008 1:47:08 AM$Reviewer: Truth (Patient) $3$2$2$I believe I have a mix of hyperactivity and inattentivness.. I'm easily distracted, like to be on the move (as if driven by a motor), its hard to stay on task, I zone-out/daydream here & there, I find it hard to be motivated, especially in school (unless I am genuinely interested in the material & feel it really applies to my life). I procrastinate, can be quite disorganized, and stress out because of this all! Thats when I dont take Adderall.  Only somewhat effective because the tablets tend to wear off as the day progresses which results in irritability, they initially get me down to business. I'd hoped that side-effecrs wouldnt apply to be but well in reality they do. this drug really is no joke and should be taken seriously because of its habit-forming tendency. i dont like the idea of depending on a substance to do things i used to be able to do without it. true, those things were harder to do before Adderall, but: when i would go a day or 2 without it, or just be on a lower dose, i found that the fatigue that set in as a result (side-effect) made those things harder than it had been before ever taking the Adderall! Essentially Adderall had picked me & dropped me lower than before =/ I don't want to go back off of it, however i do want my genuine self back, the one that isn't so serious and annoyed. high blood pressure is another thing to look out for. this can raise it. it makes me tense at times. But if you're like me you'll like it AT FIRST. It helps me work & i mean efficiently, but I don't always need this stuff.. maybe when i have a paper due but not when just hanging with friends. i made it without Adderall but it wasnt easy & it especially isnt now that i've been on it. Learning about ADD helps me understand myself better & discover under what conditions i'm best able to work. this'll make a difference in whether I decide to continue it. I of course respect that the severity of the ADD in any case also must be addressed. Dosage is also very important.
2153$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$6/30/2008 12:39:47 AM$Reviewer: scotty, 19-24 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$5$excellent medication for my hadhd i use to be  scattered, unorganized,.. ect now i work effective and sleep easily 
2154$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$6/26/2008 6:00:49 PM$Reviewer: CollegeStudent, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $4$3$4$I am a 23 year old college student.  I started taking adderall to help me with my school work about 7 months ago.  Before the medicine I procrastinated
column2: could not finish a projects
column3: was disinterested
column4: and unmotivated.  When I take this medication I shed all of those characteristics. I am able to study for about 5-8 hours straight and obtain all the information. I am in my senior year of college and thought I could use a push to finish the hard classes. I became interested in learning; I grasped concepts easily
column5: and became level headed and rational.  I will say though
column6: there is a huge downside.  I got bad headaches
column7: lost ten pounds
column8: blacked out frequently for a second when I stood up
column9: chest pains
column10: and numbness in my hands. When on the medication
column11: I lost my connection to emotion and was very irritable.  I tended to be cold and distant.  I know this medicine works but I did not want to put my body through the side effects any longer.

column1: I have stopped taking this due to the person I was becoming.  It takes more discipline for me to study and stay focused but at least I feel like my true self.
This drug is habit forming. I thought I could not get an A on a test without it
column2: but I did and I can.  Plus now when I get an A it is more rewarding knowing it was all me who earned
column3: not the adderall.

column1:
2155$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$6/26/2008 12:54:20 AM$Reviewer: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $3$1$2$Freshman yr of college i was diagnosed with ADD, the Inattentive kind. My experience with Adderall has been a love/hate relationship. I started on 20mg in a.m. & 10mg in p.m. It gave me more energy, made me mentally sharper & I felt normal & happier since I was more able to communicate & think clearly. I was happy.. at first. Then I noticed I could stay up WAY late. Then I'd sleep in & miss the classes I'd finally begun thoroughly doing the work for. Also, friends pointed out Id become irritable & mean at times. I agreed but was upset because of all the good adderall was doing for me otherwise. The tablets wore off later in the day, causing my moods. My prescriber recommended a higher dose, I agreed & I liked it, I was focused on getting my stuff done. STILL, I was.. cold, emotions were distant. IMPORTANT: check before you start this if theres a history of addictions to substances like alchohol etc in your family as this can really be HABIT-FORMING, as in my case. Also, Adderall doesnt allow refills. This was prob when back from out of state college & I had insurance- coverage issues, which forced me to go off adderall. DIFFICULT. I was SO tired, moreso than EVER before. felt like a moody addict & sad & like doing NOTHING.2nd day with no Adderall in my system, woke up during the night & threw up. Horrible & bizarre. BE CAREFUL, listen to your body's signs if on it. Try keeping lowest dose possible. Off adderall, I still had a job to get & chores ETC when just functioning was a task. Gained back the weight i'd lost, plus a few. After that I felt better each day, but back to my spacey, scattered & anxious self again. Caffiene helped, in big amts. Insurance is fixed, I caved & am back on it. They say you'll feel like a different person. Maybe, I feel my old Adderall self returning, more focused but mean. My family has noticed. Mom said i'm not my old self. & I fear I'm becoming dependent again. Im taking lower doses & may switch to Dexedrine or Adderall XR. Think.     
2156$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$6/23/2008 11:10:43 AM$Reviewer: Spinnin, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $3$3$2$I have been on adderall (20mg) for about 5 years. It is a hardcore stimulant that is similar to an illegal group of drugs if you catch my drift. Has helped me but I'm not sure if the benefit has exceeded the cost. I can't imagine children taking it so do your research first. Causes anxiety, mood swings, and an overall feeling that can only be described as BLAH.

column1: 2176$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$5/6/2008 6:26:16 PM$Reviewer: brett
column2: 19-24 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $4$1$5$"I'm 20 and in my first year of college. I was diagnosed with ADD in 6th Grade for my lack of ability to concentrate
column3: I was/am quite the day dreamer. The Doc put me on 5mg Adderall XR I believe. My freshman year the dose was increased to 10mg. At the time I didn't know fully how it effected me
column4: all I knew is that it made me want to throw desks at the teachers that irritated me
column5: and that I was unhappy and pissed of for no reason. I switched from adderall to stratera
column6: then to ritali LA
column7: but I prefered not taking anything because of how they effected me. In January I started back on Adderal XR @ 15mg and I told myself that it's worth the sacrifice to have good grades and be able to focus
column8: but I  now that I am older I am more aware of how it effects me. My grades immediately went from C's to high B's and the Highest gpa I've had in years. I quit taking it when I realized that it was destroying my life in the following ways:

column1: -Extreme OCD behavior
-Depression
-AntiSocial behavior
-Muscular twitches
-Dependence
-Most of all
column2: Loss of identity

column1: Naturally I am a outgoing person
column2: I love people
column3: I'm easy going
column4: and always have a smile on my face but Adderall flipped my world upside down. I would not recommend any parent putting their child on this medication under any circumstance
column5: if you care about them at all. ADD is not a disorder
column6: it is just a way to classify people who function on a higher/different level than the average population. ADD is a gift that our society hasn't learned how to handle.

column1: My recommendation to parents would be to look for and encourage the abilities and gifts your child has
column2: and be as supportive as you possibly can. They need to know that they are brilliant
column3: creative
column4: and gifted. The reason ADD'ers can't focus well is because they are constantly thinking! What kind of world do we live in when thinking needs to be medicated?!"

column1: 2177$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$5/3/2008 6:16:25 PM$Reviewer: brightdreamer
column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $4$1$3$I was taking this for ADD without hyperactivity. It seemed to help at first
column3: I was concentrating better
column4: keeping up with tasks
column5: and getting more things done. However
column6: I'm also being treated for depression
column7: and after only a few weeks I started noticing the symptoms of my depression coming back. After a full month on the drug
column8: I was extremely irritable
column9: overreacting to stress
column10: crying at every little thing
column11: snapping at friends and family... I really damaged a relationship with one friend
column12: sadly. Upon talking to my doctor
column13: I found out that Adderall can cause heightened emotions
column14: which is exactly what I was trying to treat with the depression medication! She offered to put me on a mood stabilizer drug as well
column15: but I said just take me off the Adderall and try something else for the ADD rather than adding another drug to fix its side effects. I'm trying Strattera now
column16: we'll see how it works. The drug did what it was supposed to do
column17: but honestly
column18: my ADD isn't bad enough to warrant taking a drug with this kind of side effect.

2181$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$4/27/2008 3:04:38 PM$Reviewer: Cat-mom
column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $5$4$4$"I have taken a low dose of adderall for about five years
column3: and it has changed my life.

column1: My ability to think ahead
column2: anticipate and avoid problems has dramatically improved. My abilty to articulate myself improves dramatically on adderal – especially with a low dose.  I can understand the consequences of my actions with a clarity that I wish I had earlier in life J My over-all attention span has dramatically improved in the last five years – and it remains significantly higher even on days when I choose not to take adderall. To me
column3: that is amazing. Tasks I once found painful
column4: I can now do quickly an efficiently with patience and perfect detail – even off adderall. A large part of why I think I see a lot of improvement is not just the medication
column5: but also all the other things I do to combat ADHD.

column1: When I need to learn something new (e.g. a software program at work) adderal helps me quickly learn and absorb the new information
column2: and remember facts. It is a dramatic change from my past abilities.

column1: When I first started taking the drug
column2: I had heart palpitations. It is definitely hard on the heart. BUT then I started to add regular
column3: gentle but rigorous aerobic exercise to my routine (which
column4: btw
column5: is a non-prescription treatment for ADHD)
column6: my heart became stronger
column7: more conditioned than before and the palpitations stopped. My resting hr is 45 bpm
column8: and my blood pressure is ideal
column9: or close to it. This also will solve any insomnia problems.

column1: I recommend this drug – FOR THE RIGHT PERSON. Fact is we are all built differently. Which is the whole reason why drugs like this are made in the first place. Depending on your peculiarities
column2: it may not give you exactly what you need.  That doesn’t mean this drug won’t be very helpful to someone else. I look forward to the day when these types of drugs can be prescribed and monitored more accurately. "

column1: 2183$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$4/21/2008 11:26:17 AM$Reviewer: c_jernigan, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $3$1$5$My initial response to Adderall XR was great - it changed my life
column2: but then ... and there is always a ""but"" in life - the effects began to wear off and then I think that Adderall began muting my endocrine system.  In a nutshell - it significantly reduced my level of perceived anxiety. I didn't realize it
column3: but I was probably living with a ""4"" on a 1 - 10 scale for general anxiety.  Adderall brought me down to a 1 or 2.  I think that basically after a month or two my adrenaline and other things were basically either all used up
column4: or the receptor sites were burned out.  Basically there was no ""fire"" because all of the fuel had been burned up.  Also
column5: I think that I had some mild depression creeping in - I became somewhat unmotivated
column6: and really didn't want to do much physically.

column1: After about 1 year my libido dropped like a rock
column2: my testicles felt as if they had shrunken to 1/2 their normal size.  My body temperature was always low - it was routinely in the mid 96 to low 97 range.  I had no physical strength nor endurance - where I had been previously in good shape and could crank out 25 pushups at any given time
column3: I could only manage 20 or so ""girl"" pushups (supported by knees) after which time I was exhausted.  After working out
column4: I didn't feel as if I was gaining any benefit or very minor benefit
column5: almost as if I was having a muted recovery.

column1: After initially becoming more organized I began slipping back
column2: then I was maybe only 25% of my initial organization.

column1: I have stopped taking XR on a daily basis and have begun taking it only ""as needed"" - what my doctor doesn't know will not hurt him.  I think that something needs to be recharged - I am now an advocate of ""drug holidays""
column2: every other day usage
column3: or simply ""as needed"" be that at work
column4: or home.

column1: I never found myself feeling mentally addicted - but I did have brain fog for a couple of days when stepping down.
I was on 30mg/day Adderall XR - 40yo male - ~18 months.

2184$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$4/16/2008 7:26:13 PM$Reviewer: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$5$I have been taking the XR 20mg a day for about 6 months now and it has completely changed my life. You would have never known I had an attention problem because I was a very active teenager.  I was involved in sports, many extracuricular activities and worked since I was 16 so my mind was constantly focused on something different.  It became a problem after becoming a single mom.  I couldn't organize any thought.  If there was too much going on I couldn't focus to organize it.  I didn't pay bills, I took extreme chances, and even forgot I was a mom sometimes.  After finally confessing to my mother how i felt she suggested talking to my PCP.  He gave me the 20mg XR 6 months ago and now I feel as though I am actually living my life.  I have since fixed my finances, gotten promoted at work, and enjoy my time with my daughter so much more.  I would suggest this treament to anyone as long as their Dr. agrees.  Use caution when taking this it can be very addicting, and should not for children that have no gone through puberty.  i have lost 30 pounds since start because of the lack of appetite and amount of exercise i do.  I also have about two nights a week that i have trouble falling asleep.  over all I thank myself every day for being able to communicate how I felt.  I am finally the person I always wanted to be and never thought could be.
2185$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$4/16/2008 3:37:53 PM$Reviewer: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $1$1$2$this drug causes extreme depression after extended use. i believe this drug should be taken OFF the market and reevaluated. this drug can cause thoughts of suicide, eratic behavior, mood swings, bouts of hysteria and overall should be in a class of its own for ONLY the severely mentally ill that need institutionalizing! the fact that CHILDREN are taking this drug is HORRIFIC and is going to end up doing more damage then good in the longrun. i truly believe that this is one of our biggest problems in America today....adults and worse yet CHILDREN AND TEENAGERS running around 0n legal meth!!!! get rid of this drug  and more importantly the thought process that people need this to pay attention.

column1: 2217$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$1/31/2008 4:36:55 PM$Reviewer: addledinindiana
column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $3$2$3$"Adult ADDer diagnosed at 5 yrs 'hyperkinetic:' prescr barbituates. At 9
column3: diff doc prescr Dexedrine: huge improvement. Family moved: no dr
column4: no meds. 'til school insisted I be treated. New doc prescr Dexedrine. Life again improved significantly. Another family move: no meds
column5: no dr.  Impulse took hold: I ran away & got married. New OB/GYN precr Obetrol (Adderall) & amphetamine for ADHD/extreme impulsivity. I felt normal again. First son was a Rit kid
column6: diagnosed ADHD at 5 years.

column1: As an adult
column2: my hyperactivity DECREASED
column3: while other ADD symptoms INCREASED: inattentiveness
column4: distractions
column5: severe impulsivity
column6: reckless behavior. I tried all the ADHD meds and methyphenidates do not work for me. On Dex Spansules & tabs 'til the '90s. Thanks to Dex
column7: I finished HS/college and attained a career (which didn't last).

column1: In '92
column2: p-doc took me from ADD meds to HIGH doses of SSRIs. Spun out-of-control for over a decade.

column1: Moved to IN in '02. After a couple of incidents resulting from my ADD I stopped SSRIs. Dr refused to prescr ADD meds & said she didn't ""believe"" in ADHD. She wrote Provigil for ""focus"" and a CPAP machine for sleep disorder
column2: neither did 'squat.' Hit rock-bottom 3 months ago & found a NP who prescribed Adderall XR 20 mg. It helped a TINY BIT. At my pleading
column3: she raised XR to 30mg & added a 10 mg d-amp tab to be broken in half
column4: 5 mg in AM with XR
column5: 5 mg early to mid PM.

column1: Her concern is my age. Phys health is GOOD: no heart
column2: liver
column3: kidney
column4: lung problems. Low BP all my life. Never smoked
column5: rarely drink maybe glass of wine once a month. XR is slow-starting
column6: so mornings are shot before I know it
column7: then have severe sleepy period in mid-aft. XR kicks in again around 5PM but then I hyperfocus on all the wrong things until 10-11PM
column8: when I binge & fidget until I go to sleep with xanax around 1AM.

column1: Here is my personal dx: I'm under-dosed. On Adderall XR
column2: a minimum 60mg x 2 plus 10mg D-amp x 2.

column1: Preference is Dex Spans + 5mg Dex tabs x 3.
XR's inconsistent & a rollercoaster ride."

column2: 19-24 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $4$3$4$I am a 23 year old recent college graduate that has been taking Adderall Oral for the past 6 to 7 months.  I was not diagnosed with ADD/ADHD until the start of my treatment.  With this treatment I have noted some very distinct changes in my performance in college and now in my career.  I am a Mechanical Engineer in NC.  My focus at work seems to be increased but not over the top.  I finally feel that I can start a project and follow it through to the end.  Finishing the minute details that have plagued me in the past and that I have procrastinated with in the past.  I feel that Adderall oral is an effective treatment for my condition.  Although I strongly urge parents and students to take caution with using this treatment option.  I have noticed a weekly to bi-weekly occurrence of limited sleep for one to two nights.  This seems to typically happen on a Friday night and Sunday nights.  As this has continued I feel that there are some other treatments that I should attempt before settling on this one.  Also as I was diagnosed during my final semester of college with ADD/ADHD I noticed that I suddenly had more friends then the prior 5 years of college.  So parents
column3: students in college with go to extreme measures to acquire Adderall from your child. This is also becoming an increasing concern for college campuses across the nation.  Like I said before
column4: I believe
column5: this medication should be taken consistently and you shouldn't miss many treatments.  Missing treatments has made me extremely groggy and lazy.  So caution to not taking it on the weekends.  I have noticed that when I continued treatment for 7 days a week I didn't have the haze
column6: groggy and lazy feeling.  Also I reduce my dosage to half during the weekends. I hope this helps all in some manner.

column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$5$Adderall has worked very well for me. My thought process is much more organized and my ability to stay focused on a conversation and tuned into the subject at hand has improved immensely.  I have over the years tried to slow and constrain my hyperactivity with lorasapam and other sedatives with only a moderate amount of success; major side effect was drossiness and fatigue. I looked into the possibilities of Adderall after speaking with a coworker who was prescribed Adderall several years ago and how he was able to continue his education due to his ability effectively concentrate.  After reading more about the symptoms associated with ADD it seemed to be a perfect match to my condition. This medication has reduced much of my public speaking inhibition; I find that I am more out going
column3: in control
column4: less critical of my self
column5: and more inclined to participate in meeting and activities with minimum anxiety. My sexual drive is actually more enhanced. I am taking 5mg three times daily
column6: but am still adjusting the dosage to alleviate side effects (inability to fall asleep at night) and achieve the maximum benefit. This has been an extremely positive life changing treatment for ADD.

column1: 2306$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$11/4/2007 1:18:11 AM$Reviewer: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $1$1$5$After a general symptom evaluation with my doctor
column2: I was prescribed Adderal and it had an extremely limited effect on my symptoms.  On top of that

column1: 2308$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$10/30/2007 7:48:45 PM$Reviewer: 13-18 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $3$1$3$I have ADHD and believe that you can over come it with out medication and stop beving this propaganda the news is telling us

column1: 2309$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$10/30/2007 7:14:13 PM$Reviewer: 13-18 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $3$3$5$I like that I can actually listen to a person and hear the whole conversation for the first time in my life. Adderall has also helped with my constant fidgeting. The thing I don't like about it though is that when I'm put into stressful situation I feel more anxiety than before I started the medication. And so far
column2: even though I understand others better
column3: I still find it challenging to process my own thoughts quickly and effectively. I have so many things popping into my head that it’s all just a jumble and I can’t get my ideas out in a way that works for others. Maybe that’s just because I have only been taking it for a few months or am not on the correct dosage yet. Don’t let it defer you.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $3$1$5$As an adult female who has been taking this drug for years I would warn against it. It works well for me
column3: although it took a long time to find the correct doseage-10mg
column4: but I could NEVER imagine giving this to a child. I am on a low dose and I really feel side effects. Such as tenseness
column5: irratation
column6: lightheadedness
column7: and I just am not myself when I take it. Although the drug does work
column8: I would only recommend it for adults that know their bodies well and know how and when it works for them. It does have sexual side effects as well. For those looking for something for a child
column9: look for something other than these meds
column10: they are NOT for children!

column1: 2344$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$9/20/2007 8:14:25 AM$Reviewer: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$5$It was a wonder for me! column5: and overall I accomplish the goals I set forth each day. Thank God my doctor finally listened when others did not.
